rhapisma: <entryFree id="n41642" type="main" key="rha^pisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† rhăpisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/pisma,</foreign> <sense id="n41642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blow with the palm of the hand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 49, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhapsodia: <entryFree id="n41643" type="main" key="rhapso_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† rhapsōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(ayw|di/a,</foreign> <sense id="n41643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhapsody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the second book of the Iliad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhea: <entryFree id="n41644" type="main" key="Rhe_a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old Italian name.</hi> Thus, Rhea Silvia, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Numitor and mother of Romulus and Remus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 174</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 276</bibl>).—Hence comes <hi rend="ital">the name of the fabled priestess</hi> Rhea in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 659</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41645" type="main" key="Rhe^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(re/a,</foreign> <sense id="n41645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:201" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhea, quae Latiis Ops,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl></cit> de Deis, 2.</sense></entryFree>
rhectae: <entryFree id="n41646" type="main" key="rhe_ctae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† rhēctae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(h=ktai,</foreign> <sense id="n41646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of earthquake</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 65, 26.</sense></entryFree>
rheda: <entryFree id="n41647" type="main" key="rhe_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhēda</orth>, v. raeda.</entryFree>
rhedarius: <entryFree id="n41648" type="main" key="rhe_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhēdārĭus</orth>, v. raedarius.</entryFree>
rhedones: <entryFree id="n41649" type="main" key="Rhe_do^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēdŏnes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rēd-</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of the modern Rennes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bretagne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhegium: <entryFree id="n41650" type="main" key="Rhe_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēgĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēgīnus</orth>, <itype>incorrect spelling for Regium and Reginus</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
rhenanus: <entryFree id="n41651" type="main" key="Rhe_na_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rhenus.</entryFree>
rhene: <entryFree id="n41652" type="main" key="Rhe_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rh/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n41652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rheno: <entryFree id="n41653" type="main" key="rhe_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhēno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. reno.</entryFree>
rhenus: <entryFree id="n41654" type="main" key="Rhe_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the river which divided Gaul from Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17</bibl>; 6, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 88</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhē-nānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rhenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 17</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:35:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 35, 4</bibl>, Rhenigenam is the better reading).<orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>;</sense><sense id="n41654.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers on the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Germans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:286" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl>; hence, <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes locat Rhenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 47</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41654.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small river in Italy tributary to the Po</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Reno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:599" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 599</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhesus: <entryFree id="n41655" type="main" key="Rhe_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rh=sos,</foreign> <sense id="n41655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of a Muse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a king in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was robbed of his horses and killed by Diomede and Ulysses before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 469</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:249 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 249 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
rhetenor: <entryFree id="n41656" type="main" key="Rhe_te_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhētēnor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Diomede</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 504</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetico: <entryFree id="n41657" type="main" key="Rheti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhetĭco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range in Germany</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Siebengebirge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Bonn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetor: <entryFree id="n41658" type="greek" key="rhe_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(h/twr,</foreign> <sense id="n41658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher of oratory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui rhetores nominarentur et qui dicendi praecepta traderent, nihil plane tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl>: in rhetorum<pb n="1593" /> <cb n="RHIN" />  scholis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:23" default="NO">12, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorum artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorum epilogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pueri) priusquam tradantur rhetori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 30</bibl> and 35; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2, 1</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41658.1" n="II" level="1"> After the Greek manner, <hi rend="ital">an orator;</hi> but with contempt, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speechifier</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia rhetoris Attica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with § 1.</sense></entryFree>
rhetorica: <entryFree id="n41659" type="main" key="rhe_to^ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. rhetoricus.</entryFree>
rhetorice: <entryFree id="n41660" type="main" key="rhe_to^ri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rhetoricus <sense id="n41660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rhetorico: <entryFree id="n41661" type="main" key="rhe_to^ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (ante-class.), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (post-class.) [rhetoricus], <sense id="n41661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak rhetorically</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like an orator</hi>, Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 476, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 216 Rib.); <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetoricoteros: <entryFree id="n41662" type="greek" key="rhe_to^ri^co_te^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcōtĕros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(htorikw/teros,</foreign> <sense id="n41662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">more oratorical</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetoricus: <entryFree id="n41663" type="greek" key="rhe_to^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(htoriko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41663.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro more aliquando, non rhetorico loquamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a treatise on rhetoric</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorici doctores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>teachers of rhetoric</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllogismus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:57" default="NO">9, 4, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <trans><tr>books on rhetoric</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n41663.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41663.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (the first form in Cic., the latter in Quint.), <hi rend="ital">the art of oratory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetoric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam, si potero, rhetorice, sed hac rhetoricā philosophorum, non nostrā illa forensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorice est bene dicendi scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rhetorice, cui nomen vis eloquentiae dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus rhetorices, id. prooem. § 23: rhetoricen exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO">2, 15, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rhetorice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41663.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n41663.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Teachers of oratory</hi>, = rhetores, ipsi magistri, qui rhetorici vocantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 52</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41663.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Books on rhetoric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi rhetoricos suos (the erroneouslynamed books de Inventione) ipse adulescenti sibi elapsos diceret (Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in rhetoricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; also in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ex Ciceronis rhetorico primo manifestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:58" default="NO">3, 6, 58</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41663.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">rhetoric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorica mihi vestra sunt nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an oratorical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhetorical manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oratorically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorice igitur nos mavis quam dialectice disputare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus mortem rhetorice et tragice ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam rhetorice!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetoriscus: <entryFree id="n41664" type="greek" key="rhe_to^riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rhetor</etym>, <sense id="n41664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little rhetorician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhetorisso: <entryFree id="n41665" type="greek" key="rhe_to^risso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētŏrisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(htori/zw,</foreign> <sense id="n41665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak rhetorically</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 3</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 201 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
rhetra: <entryFree id="n41666" type="greek" key="rhe_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhētra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(h/tra,</foreign> <sense id="n41666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (leges) ex rhetris Lycurgi reparavit Sylla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rheuma: <entryFree id="n41667" type="greek" key="rheuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rheuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(eu=ma.</foreign> <sense id="n41667.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris (i. e. aestus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41667.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A catarrh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rheum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 122, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rheumaticus: <entryFree id="n41668" type="greek" key="rheuma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rheumătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(eumatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one troubled with rheum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has a catarrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rheumatismus: <entryFree id="n41669" type="greek" key="rheuma^tismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rheumătismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(eumatismo)s,</foreign> <sense id="n41669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rheum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catarrh</hi> (pure Lat. fluctio): <cit><quote lang="la">levis humoris fluor quem Graeci rheumatismum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:27:146" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 27, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 2, 32, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 3, 3, § 7</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
rheumatizo: <entryFree id="n41670" type="greek" key="rheuma^ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rheumătīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(eumati/zomai,</foreign> <sense id="n41670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be troubled with rheum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a catarrh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhexia: <entryFree id="n41671" type="greek" key="rhexia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhexia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> onochilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 25, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhina: <entryFree id="n41672" type="greek" key="rhi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(i/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n41672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of whose skin arrows were made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhinenchytes: <entryFree id="n41673" type="greek" key="rhi_nenchy^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīnenchytes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(inegxu/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n41673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for making injections into the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 7" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 7</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīn-engytos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:4:82" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 4, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhinion: <entryFree id="n41674" type="greek" key="rhi_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(i/nion,</foreign> collyrium, <sense id="n41674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment for removing scars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhinoceros: <entryFree id="n41675" type="greek" key="rhi_no^ce^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīnŏcĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(ino/kerws.</foreign> <sense id="n41675.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rhinoceros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 20, 29, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:22" default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Epigr. 14:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 14, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:52:2" default="NO">14, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:5" default="NO">9, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>: cornua<cb n="RHOD" />  rhinocerotis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 33, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41675.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel made of the rhinoceros</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:130" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 130</bibl>.— A nickname for <hi rend="ital">a man with a long nose</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 30</bibl> (v. brochus).— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: nasum rhinocerotis habere,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to turn up the nose</tr>, <tr>to sneer at every thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīnŏcĕrōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of a rhinoceros</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naris,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>sneering</tr>, <tr>mockery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 339</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhinocolura: <entryFree id="n41676" type="main" key="Rhi_no^co^lu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīnŏcŏlūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the borders of Syria and Egypt on the shore of the Mediterranean</hi>, prob. the mod. <hi rend="ital">El-Arish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhinton: <entryFree id="n41677" type="main" key="Rhinton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhinton</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-thon</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the originator of travestied tragedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 9</bibl> (cited also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
rhion: <entryFree id="n41678" type="main" key="Rhi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n41678.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strait between the Ionian Sea and the Corinthian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41678.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory of Achaia near this strait</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastro Morea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41678.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town near the same strait</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30</bibl> (al. Aegium).</sense></entryFree>
rhipaei: <entryFree id="n41679" type="main" key="Rhi_paei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīpaei</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīphaei</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rīp-</orth>), <itype>montes</itype>, <sense id="n41679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a range of mountains in the most northern part of Scythia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where are the sources of the Tanais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:1" default="NO">2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:1" default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:4:5 al" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 4, 5 al.</bibl> — Less freq. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhipaeus mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 18</bibl></cit> and 20.— Hence <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhī-paeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīphaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rīp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rhiphæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:420" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:603" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 603</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:77" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:1" default="NO">2, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhizias: <entryFree id="n41680" type="greek" key="rhi_zi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīzĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(izi/as,</foreign> <sense id="n41680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juice extracted from a root</hi> (opp. caulias), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhizinium: <entryFree id="n41681" type="main" key="Rhi_zini^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīzinĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n41681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Dalmatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the Gulf of Cattaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīzon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, now <hi rend="ital">Risano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhīzōnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of this town</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhizotomos: <entryFree id="n41682" type="greek" key="rhi_zo^to^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīzŏtŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of iris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 19, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhizotomumena: <entryFree id="n41683" type="greek" key="rhi_zo^to^mu_me^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhīzŏtŏmūmĕna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(izotomou/mena,</foreign> <sense id="n41683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descriptions of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instructions about medicines prepared from roots cut up</hi> (the name of a book written by Micion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rho: <entryFree id="n41684" type="greek" key="rho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rho</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(w=,</foreign> <sense id="n41684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of the letter</hi> r, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoda: <entryFree id="n41685" type="main" key="Rho^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n41685.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Hispania Tarraconensis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rosas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Rhone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhodanicus: <entryFree id="n41686" type="main" key="Rho^da^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdănĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rhodanus, I. 1.</entryFree>
rhodanus: <entryFree id="n41687" type="main" key="Rho^da^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41687.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Rhone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a river in Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:446 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 446 sq.</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodani potor,</quote> <trans><tr>a dweller by the Rhone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41687.1" n="1" level="3"> RHODANICI NAVTAE, <hi rend="ital">sailors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boatmen on the Rhone</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 809</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4110</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4223</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41687.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Rhone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>situated upon the Rhone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. Carm. 9, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41687.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdănū-sĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Rhone City</hi>, Lugdunum, now <hi rend="ital">Lyons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n41687.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers by the Rhone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gauls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheno Rhodanoque subactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 268</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhodiacus: <entryFree id="n41688" type="main" key="Rho^di^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rhodos, II. 2.</entryFree>
rhodiensis: <entryFree id="n41689" type="main" key="Rho^di^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Rhodos, II. 3.</entryFree>
rhodinus: <entryFree id="n41690" type="greek" key="rho^di^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(o/dinos,</foreign> <sense id="n41690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared from roses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <trans><tr>rose-salve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>oil of roses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoditis: <entryFree id="n41691" type="greek" key="rho^di_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhodius: <entryFree id="n41692" type="main" key="Rho^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Rhodos, II. 1.</entryFree>
rhodo: <entryFree id="n41693" type="main" key="Rhodo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhodo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Q. Minucius Thermus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhododaphne: <entryFree id="n41694" type="greek" key="rho^do^daphne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdŏdaphnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(ododa/fnh,</foreign> <sense id="n41694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rose-bay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oleander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 20, 33, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:90" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 53, § 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhododendros: <entryFree id="n41695" type="greek" key="rho^do^dendros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdŏdendros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdŏ-dendron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(odo/dendron,</foreign> <sense id="n41695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rosebay</hi>,<cb n="RHOM" />  <hi rend="ital">oleander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 20, 33, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:77" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 13, 45, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:90" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 53, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhodomeli: <entryFree id="n41696" type="greek" key="rho^do^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏdŏmĕli</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(odo/meli,</foreign> <sense id="n41696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey of roses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 16</bibl> Maist.</sense></entryFree>
rhodope: <entryFree id="n41697" type="main" key="Rho^do^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rodo/ph.</foreign> <sense id="n41697.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain range in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Hæmus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Despoto Dagh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 77</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Acc. to the myth, originally a man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:87 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 87 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41697.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:181" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 181</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41697.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdŏ-pēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rhodopean</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:347" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Progne</tr>, <tr>wife of the Thracian king Tereus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41697.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdŏ-pēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 618</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhodora: <entryFree id="n41698" type="foreign" key="rhodo_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhodōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (Gallic), <sense id="n41698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a plant</hi>: Spiraea ulmaria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 112, § 172</bibl> (al. rodarum).</sense></entryFree>
rhodos: <entryFree id="n41699" type="main" key="Rho^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdos</orth> (rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ro/dos.</foreign> <sense id="n41699.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island on the coast of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its pure air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for its Colossus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its school of rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the skill of its people in navigation;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:365 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 365 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41699.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the nymph of this island</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 204</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41699.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n41699.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rhodian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 574</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli, gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:12 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:11" default="NO">8, 11, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Colossus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 71, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (eloquentiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Rhodians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:22:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 22, 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41699.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rhodian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glutinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 71, § 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peristylium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41699.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rhodian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhŏdĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Rhodians</hi>: oratio pro Rhodiensibus, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoduntia: <entryFree id="n41700" type="main" key="Rhodunti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoduntĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three summits of Mount Œta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoeas: <entryFree id="n41701" type="greek" key="rhoea^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhoeăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhoea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(oia/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild-poppy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 53, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:204" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 19, 77, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoeteum: <entryFree id="n41702" type="main" key="Rhoete_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoetēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(roi/teion,</foreign> <sense id="n41702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city built on a promontory of the same name in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Hellespont</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Cape Barbieri</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 38</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
rhoeteus: <entryFree id="n41703" type="main" key="Rhoete_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoetēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(roiteios,</foreign> <sense id="n41703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the promontory of Rhœteum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rhœtean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundum,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea that washes it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 197</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhoeteum rapax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:279" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 279</bibl></cit>.— Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:115" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41703.1" n="2" level="3"> Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoetē-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>, and transf. for <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:431" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:621" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lancea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41704" type="main" key="Rhoeteus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoeteus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Rutulian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 399</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">402</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoetus: <entryFree id="n41705" type="main" key="Rhoetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoetus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhoecus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41705.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:271 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 271 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:140" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 140</bibl>.—Form Rhoecus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 390</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41705.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 38</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41705.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Marsians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 388</bibl> Serv.</sense></entryFree>
rhoicus: <entryFree id="n41706" type="greek" key="rho^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(oi+ko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sumach</hi> (rhus), <hi rend="ital">sumach-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 54, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoites: <entryFree id="n41707" type="greek" key="rho^i_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(oi/+ths</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n41707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pomegranate wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhomboides: <entryFree id="n41708" type="greek" key="rhombo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhombŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(omboeide/s,</foreign> in mathematics, <sense id="n41708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a four-sided figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose opposite sides and angles are equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rhomboid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 36</bibl> Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 712</bibl>. <pb n="1594" /> <cb n="RICA" /></sense></entryFree>
rhombus: <entryFree id="n41709" type="main" key="rhombus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhombus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(o/mbos.</foreign> <sense id="n41709.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A magician</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s circle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 35</bibl> (3, 25, 1); 3, 6, 26 (4, 5, 26); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:17" default="NO">12, 57, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41709.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatfish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48</bibl>; 49; 95; 2, 8, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:68" default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:119" default="NO">119</bibl>; 11, 121; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:81 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 81 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41709.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mathematical figure whose four sides and opposite angles are equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rhomb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 36</bibl> Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 712</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhomphaea: <entryFree id="n41710" type="greek" key="rhomphaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhomphaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (pure Latin form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpīa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>; with <sense id="n41710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> short, rumpĭa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:98" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 98</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(omfai/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a long missile weapon</hi> of barbarous nations: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpia genus teli est Thracae nationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis acuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 2, 12</bibl>; Val. Fl. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 27</bibl>; Ascon. Argum. Milon.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhomphaeālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> rhomphaea: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhonchisonus: <entryFree id="n41711" type="hapax" key="rhonchi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhonchĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rhonchus</etym>, <sense id="n41711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snorting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhinoceros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoncho: <entryFree id="n41712" type="hapax" key="rhoncho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhoncho</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhonchus: <entryFree id="n41713" type="main" key="rhonchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† rhonchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(o/gxos.</foreign> <sense id="n41713.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A snoring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41713.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the croaking</hi> of a frog, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41713.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sneering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sneer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:87:7" default="NO">4, 87, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhondes: <entryFree id="n41714" type="main" key="Rhondes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhondes</orth>, v. Icadius.</entryFree>
rhopalon: <entryFree id="n41715" type="greek" key="rho^pa^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhŏpălon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(o/palon,</foreign> <sense id="n41715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> nymphaea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 37, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhosos: <entryFree id="n41716" type="main" key="Rho_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhōsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rw=sos,</foreign> <sense id="n41716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where highly prized utensils were made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41716.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhōsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rhosos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41716.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhōsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Rhosos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhoxolani: <entryFree id="n41717" type="main" key="Rhoxo^la_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhoxŏlāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rox-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe in Eastern Europe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhus: <entryFree id="n41718" type="greek" key="rhu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhūs</orth>, <itype>rhŏis</itype> (also corrupted into roris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 3</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> rore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 15, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:142" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 142</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">r(ou=s,</foreign> <sense id="n41718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bushy shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 54, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 6, 13, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 111" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 111</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> rhun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 79, § 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhuselinon: <entryFree id="n41719" type="greek" key="rhu_se^li_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhūsĕlīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(ouse/linon,</foreign> <sense id="n41719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> apium rusticum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhyndacus: <entryFree id="n41720" type="main" key="Rhynda^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhyndăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ru/ndakos,</foreign> <sense id="n41720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river between Mysia and Bithynia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Mualitsch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:217" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 34, 39, § 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhyparographos: <entryFree id="n41721" type="greek" key="rhy^pa^rogra^phos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhypărogrăphos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uparogra/fos,</foreign> <sense id="n41721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a painter of low</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mean subjects</hi>, a surname of Pyreicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhypodes: <entryFree id="n41722" type="greek" key="rhy^po_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhypōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(upw/dhs,</foreign> <sense id="n41722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smeared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a drawing plaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 15</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
rhysaddir: <entryFree id="n41723" type="main" key="Rhysaddir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhysaddir</orth>, <itype>ĭris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and harbor of Mauretania Tingitana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Melilla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 2, § 18</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rusgāda</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhythmice: <entryFree id="n41724" type="main" key="rhythmi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmikh/,</foreign> sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh,</foreign> <sense id="n41724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of observing rhythm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhythmice est ars omnis in numeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 969</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhythmicus: <entryFree id="n41725" type="greek" key="rhythmi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pays attention to rhythm</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">who teaches the art of preserving rhythm in composition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melo favente rhythmico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhythmizomenon: <entryFree id="n41726" type="main" key="rhythmizo^me^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmizŏmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmizo/menon,</foreign> <sense id="n41726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is reduced to measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhythm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 967 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rhythmoides: <entryFree id="n41727" type="main" key="rhythmo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmoeidh/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like rhythm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhythmical</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 970</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhythmopoeia: <entryFree id="n41728" type="main" key="rhythmo^poei^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmŏpoeĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmopoii/+a,</foreign> <sense id="n41728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">modulation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 970 and 994.</sense></entryFree>
rhythmos: <entryFree id="n41729" type="greek" key="rhythmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhythmos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uqmo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n41729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhythm</hi> in music or speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 967</bibl> sqq.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 512</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:45 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 45 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:51" default="NO">51</bibl> sq.; 78; 109 (Cicero constantly has numerus instead of this word, which he writes only as Greek, Or. 20, 67; 51, 170).</sense></entryFree>
rhytium: <entryFree id="n41730" type="greek" key="rhy^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhytĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(u/tion,</foreign> <sense id="n41730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hornshaped drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:35:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 35, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rica: <entryFree id="n41731" type="main" key="ri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a veil to be thrown over the head</hi>, worn by the Roman women when sacrificing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl> Müll.; Plaut. <cb n="RIDE" /> Ep. 2, 2, 48; Lucil., Novius, and Serenus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 18 sq.</bibl>; Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:28" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10, 4</bibl>; Fest. pp. 288 and 289 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
riciniatus: <entryFree id="n41732" type="main" key="ri_ci_ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīcīnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ricinium</etym>, <sense id="n41732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing</hi> a ricinium: mimi, Auct. ap. Fest. s. v. recinium, p. 277 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ricinium: <entryFree id="n41733" type="main" key="ri_ci_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīcīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rica</etym>, <sense id="n41733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small veil thrown over the head by the early Romans</hi>, esp. by women and mourners, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=132" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 132</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 64</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. recinium, p. 274 Müll.; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ricinus: <entryFree id="n41734" type="hapax" key="ri_ci_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">veiled</hi>: mitra, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41735" type="main" key="ri^ci^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41735.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A large kind of vermin that infests sheep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dogs</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a tick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tike</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:6" default="NO">6, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 36, 699</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41735.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> cici <hi rend="ital">and</hi> croton, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41735.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The germ of the mulberry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ricino Graeci vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 71, § 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ricto: <entryFree id="n41736" type="hapax" key="ricto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ricto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ringor</etym>, <sense id="n41736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make the natural cry of a leopard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rictum: <entryFree id="n41737" type="main" key="rictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. rictus <sense id="n41737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rictus: <entryFree id="n41738" type="main" key="rictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat, form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> ricta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1064</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 18 sq.</bibl>) [ringor], <sense id="n41738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the aperture of the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mouth wide open</hi> (esp. for laughing; class.; cf. hiatus): rictus parvissimus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 9</bibl>; Lucil. Titin. and Pompon. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1195</bibl>; Cic. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:230 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 230 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 283</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 126</bibl>.—Of animals, <hi rend="ital">gaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distended jaws</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 741</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:272" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 272</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1064</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 674</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 378</bibl>; 11, 59; 14, 65 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41738.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">the opening of the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 757</bibl> Cort.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1168" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1276" default="NO">1276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ricula: <entryFree id="n41739" type="main" key="ri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rica</etym>, <sense id="n41739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small veil</hi>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">549, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 31, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
