rideo: <entryFree id="n41740" type="main" key="ri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n41740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form ridetur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Bœot. <foreign lang="greek">kridde/men</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">kri/zein = gela=n,</foreign> orig. form <foreign lang="greek">krid</foreign><hi rend="ital">j</hi><foreign lang="greek">emen</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n41740.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to laugh</hi> (cf. cachinnor). </sense><sense id="n41740.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ullo die risi adaeque Neque hoc quod reliquom est plus risuram opinor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risi te hodie multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridere convivae, cachinnare ipse Apronius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Crassum semel ait in vitā risisse Lucilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ridere voles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: ridetque (deus), si mortalis ultra Fas trepidat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 31</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 95 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 105</bibl>: ridentem dicere verum Quid vetat, <hi rend="ital">while laughing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a laughing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jesting manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 1</bibl>.—With a homogeneous object: ridere <foreign lang="greek">ge/lwta sarda/nion,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus flendi et tempus ridendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41740.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41740.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To laugh pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smile;</hi> and ridere ad aliquem or alicui, <hi rend="ital">to smile on one</hi> (so almost entirely <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. renideo): Juppiter hic risit tempestatesque serenae Riserunt omnes risu Jovis omnipotentis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 254</bibl> (Ann. v. 445 sq. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu Fortuna sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridere ad patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 219</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41740.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to laugh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smile</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to look cheerful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes quietae large diffuso lumine rident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum et pulchra Sicyonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille terrarum mihi praeter omnes Angulus ridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum coloribus almus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonum ridenti lepore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 502</bibl></cit>; cf.: colocasia mixta ridenti acantho, <hi rend="ital">smiling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">glad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 20</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi rident aequora ponti,</quote> <trans><tr>smile upon thee</tr>, <tr>look brightly up to thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 285</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n41740.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To laugh in ridicule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mock</hi> (cf. II. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque potentior Largis muneribus riserit aemuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41740.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to laugh at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh over</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n41740.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 478</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">rideo hunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acrisium (Juppiter et Venus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">risi nivem atram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joca tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego non rideo, quamvis tu rideas,</quote> <trans><tr>say in jest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo illic vitia ridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: perjuria amantum<cb n="RIDI" />  (Juppiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 633</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: perjuros amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 47.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitryoniaden perdere Sidonios umeris amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:648" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 648</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec enim ridentur vel sola vel maxime, quae notant et designant turpitudinem aliquam non turpiter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum enim non sal, sed natura ridetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>. 69, 279; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 70, 281: ridetur ab omni Conventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque acute tantum ac venuste, sed stulte, iracunde, timide dicta aut facta ridentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in mimis rideri solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41740.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41740.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To smile upon</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi muti silent Neque me rident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non risere parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41740.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To laugh at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridicule</hi> a person or thing (milder than deridere, <hi rend="ital">to deride</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ridet nostram amentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O rem, quam homines soluti ridere non desinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:39:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 39, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dederis nobis quemadmodum scripseris ad me, quem semper ridere possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curre et quam primum haec risum veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus Enni gravitate minores (with reprehendere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risimus et merito nuper poëtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostram diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesaga Verba senis (with spernere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas manus impia nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:657" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 657</bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhi ridetur largitas a consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rideatur merito, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 356</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rideri possit eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccet ad extremum ridendus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ridibundus: <entryFree id="n41741" type="main" key="ri_di^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rideo</etym>, <sense id="n41741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laughing</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Orat. 1</bibl>, Fragm. 12: ridibunda ea dicitur quae ridentem agit aut simulat, Ter. Sc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ridica: <entryFree id="n41742" type="main" key="ridica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ridica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> In agriculture, a <sense id="n41742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vine-prop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:26" default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:12 al" default="NO">11, 2, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ridicula: <entryFree id="n41743" type="hapax" key="ridicu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ridicŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ridica</etym>, <sense id="n41743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a peg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plug</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3</bibl> (al. tendiculae).</sense></entryFree>
ridicularius: <entryFree id="n41744" type="main" key="ri_di^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ridiculus</etym>, <sense id="n41744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that excites laughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funny</hi> (ante- and post-class.).—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41744.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">jests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drolleries</hi>: ridicularia fundere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41744.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a droll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a jester</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ridicule: <entryFree id="n41745" type="main" key="ri_di^cu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ridiculus <sense id="n41745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ridiculosus: <entryFree id="n41746" type="main" key="ri_di^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ridiculus</etym>, <sense id="n41746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droll</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">parasitus ridiculosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ridiculosa ut scribis, sed ridicula mihi forte res accidit,</quote> <trans><tr>not comical</tr>, <tr>but ridiculous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Rufin. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ridiculus: <entryFree id="n41747" type="main" key="ri_di^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rideo</etym>, <sense id="n41747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that excites laughter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41747.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amusing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetious</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: jocularis, jocosus). </sense><sense id="n41747.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis ridiculus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando adbibero, alludiabo, tum sum ridiculissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ridiculum hominem quaeret quispiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavillator facie magis quam facetiis ridiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus,</quote> <trans><tr>a funny little mouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inest lepos ludusque in hac comoediā: ridicula res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicula et jocosa res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 1</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">dico unum ridiculum dictum de dictis melioribus . . . nemo ridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">logos ridiculos vendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus gestusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: ridiculum est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculum est, te istuc me admonere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 112</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 94</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui, tam cito? ridiculum!</quote> <trans><tr>how comical!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 8</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Porcius) Ridiculus totas simul obsorbere placentas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41747.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41747.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭ-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a jester</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buffoon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gelasimo nomen mihi indidit parvo pater. Quia inde jam a pauxillo puero ridiculus fui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl> and 64; <pb n="1595" /> <cb n="RIGE" /> 4, 2, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,043:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Hab. 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41747.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a laughing matter; a jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joke</hi>, etc.: proprium materiae, de quā nunc loquimur, est ridiculum, ideoque haec tota disputatio a Graecis <foreign lang="greek">peri\ geloi/ou</foreign> inscribitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:235 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 235 sq.</bibl> (v. the whole chapter on laughter, when and how it should be excited, etc., Cic. l. l.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">de risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">in jaciendo mittendoque ridiculo genera plura sunt ... illud admonemus, ridiculo sic usurum oratorem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ridiculum dicere (opp. severe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculi causā (with joco),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi solae ridiculo fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>I had the joke all to myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus sint ridicula tractanda oratori, perquam diligenter videndum est ... materies omnis ridiculorum est in istis vitiis, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam sententiose ridicula dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetum non tantum circa ridicula consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicula aut facimus aut dicimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41747.6" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridiculous</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rideo, II. B. 2.): hujus insania, quae ridiaula est aliis, mihi tum molesta sane fuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ridiculus minus illo (es)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulta reprehendere facillimum est, nam per se sunt ridicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(with stulta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma (shortly before: inculti versus et male nati),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 55</bibl></cit>.— Ridiculum est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ridiculum, ad ea quae habemus nihil dicere, quaerere, quae habere non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:18:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de confessis praecipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīdĭ-cŭlē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n41747.7" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Laughably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jokingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo acute, sed etiam ridicule ac facete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 71, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>; Domit. Mars. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicule magis hoc dictum quam vere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41747.8" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Ridiculously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rien: <entryFree id="n41748" type="main" key="ri^e_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭēn</orth>, v. renes <sense id="n41748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rigatio: <entryFree id="n41749" type="main" key="ri^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rigo</etym>, <sense id="n41749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moistening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:48" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 14 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rigator: <entryFree id="n41750" type="main" key="ri^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waterer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
rigatus: <entryFree id="n41751" type="main" key="ri^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watering</hi> (eccl. Lat.); fig., Ambros. de Isaac, 1, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 6, 85 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 7, 21, 3.</sense></entryFree>
rigefacio: <entryFree id="n41752" type="main" key="ri^ge^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rigeo</etym>, <sense id="n41752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stiffen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rigens: <entryFree id="n41753" type="main" key="ri^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of rigeo.</entryFree>
rigeo: <entryFree id="n41754" type="main" key="ri^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>prob. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">r(ige/w,</foreign> frigeo</etym>, <sense id="n41754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numb; to stiffen</hi> (syn.: concresco, conglacio). </sense><sense id="n41754.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41754.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 891</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (opp. uri calore): <cit><quote lang="la">gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 82, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata rigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridus December,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 95</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41754.3" n="2" level="3"> Of any physical stiffness: <cit><quote lang="la">gelido comae terrore rigebant,</quote> <trans><tr>stood on end</tr>, <tr>bristled up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 100</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ora indurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:503" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua cervix (with horrent setae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerealia dona rigent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are hardened into gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes auroque ostroque,</quote> <trans><tr>are stiff</tr>, <tr>stand out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terga boum plumbo insuto ferroque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicae ex auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1427</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41754.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">to stand stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pars summa scopuli) riget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 526</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">late riget Tmolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine frondibus arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:691" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illitterati num minus nervi rigent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41754.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remain unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inert</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">feritas immota riget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:31:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 31, 5</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbending</hi> (mostly post-class.). </sense><sense id="n41754.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">secui madidas ungue rigente genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica ex aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:117" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars mundi ipsis aquilonis conceptaculis rigentissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput (with praedurum),</quote> <trans><tr>rigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl>: interque<cb n="RIGO" />  rigentes (partes terrae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:165" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41754.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 413" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 413</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir tot malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rigesco: <entryFree id="n41755" type="main" key="ri^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgesco</orth>, <itype>gui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [rigeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numb; to stiffen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harden</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n41755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41755.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes indutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae in grandines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 155</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41755.3" n="2" level="3"> From other causes: <cit><quote lang="la">oratori eloquentissimo, dum ad dicendum componitur, summa riguerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillata sole rigescunt electra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:357" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:554" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgone corpora visā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 209</bibl></cit> et saep.: si Parthi vos nihil calficiunt, nos non nihil frigore rigescimus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41755.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bristle up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensi metu riguisse capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:97" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41755.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: numquam corrupta rigescent Saecula? i. e. <hi rend="ital">will grow serious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rigide: <entryFree id="n41756" type="main" key="ri^gi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rigidus <sense id="n41756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rigiditas: <entryFree id="n41757" type="main" key="ri^gi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rigidus</etym>, <sense id="n41757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rigido: <entryFree id="n41758" type="main" key="ri^gi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make firm</hi> (very rare); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: (virtus) rigidari quidem, amplius intendi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rigidus: <entryFree id="n41759" type="main" key="ri^gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rigeo</etym>, <sense id="n41759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; cf. durus). </sense><sense id="n41759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 521</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidum permanat frigus ad ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 764</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem rectam oportet esse non rigidam aut supinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">setae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:428" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:425" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi (with extenti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:529" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 53</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In mal. part.: illud,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:49:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 49, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence: custos ruris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Priapus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 391</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 46</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭda</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 613</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:517" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>rocky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:797" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 797</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niphates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 304</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41759.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid; hardy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis, severus): vox,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabini,</quote> <trans><tr>rough</tr>, <tr>rude</tr>, <tr>unpolished</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 797</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Getae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossor,</quote> <trans><tr>hardy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 71, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis verae custos rigidusque satelles,</quote> <trans><tr>stern</tr>, <tr>inflexible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">censor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidi et tristes satellites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) rigidae innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the younger Cato: rigidi servator honesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 389</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigida duraque sententia Macri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:21:3" default="NO">21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:81:4" default="NO">81, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <trans><tr>rough</tr>, <tr>fierce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 65, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non intellegit Canachi signa rigidiora esse quam ut imitentur veritatem?</quote> <trans><tr>too stiff</tr>, <tr>hard</tr>, <tr>harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similis in statuariis differentia ... jam minus rigida Calamis fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abdera fatua et stoliditatis rigidissimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 164</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgĭdē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n41759.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Inflexibly; in a straight line</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41759.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Rigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:251" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 251</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam militarem rigidius adstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rigo: <entryFree id="n41760" type="main" key="ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgo</orth> <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bre/xw,</foreign> to wet; Germ. Regen, rain</etym>. <sense id="n41760.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi> any thing with a liquid (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: irrigo, madefacio). </sense><sense id="n41760.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres omnia maria ac terras sparguntque rigantque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus rigat Aegyptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 714</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 48</bibl> (for which, irrigat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">prata (fons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 602</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:210" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 210</bibl>; cf.: lucum perenni aquā (fons). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos (Euphratis) accolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">seminaria (opp. conspergere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā Tanais Getas rigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:146" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 251</bibl></cit>: fletibus<cb n="RIMA" />  ora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 532</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 990 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 990 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes nimbique rigantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 521</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">accolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41760.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: natos vitali rore, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to suckle</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">solis uti lux ac vapor cernuntur terras rigare,</quote> <trans><tr>bedew</tr>, <tr>flood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 203</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 592</bibl>: Babylonica, <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi> (sc. with urine), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1026" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1026</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41760.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium ingenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora alicujus Philetaeā aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 3, 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41760.4" n="II" level="1"> Like irrigo, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> water or any other liquid to a place (very rare). </sense><sense id="n41760.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aquam Albanam emissam per agros rigabis (= ad rigandum diduces), an old oracle in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalem sanguinem per venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41760.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc motus per membra rigantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are directed</tr>, <tr>conveyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 262</bibl></cit>: somnum per pectora, Furius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (for which, irrigat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 908</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 692</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
rigodulum: <entryFree id="n41761" type="main" key="Rigo^du_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rigŏdūlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n41761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the territory of the Treviri</hi>, on the Mosella, now <hi rend="ital">Reol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rigor: <entryFree id="n41762" type="main" key="ri^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rigeo</etym>, <sense id="n41762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numbness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic.; cf. durities). </sense><sense id="n41762.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem bruma nives affert pigrumque rigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicis,</quote> <trans><tr>stiffness</tr>, <tr>rigidity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 52, § 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8, 28, § 89</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immobilis faciei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus (in portraits),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a cramp</tr>, <tr>spasm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit> and 7; so too simply rigor; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 81, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41762.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n41762.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A straight course</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:12:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 12, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:41" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; hence, in the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">a straight line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">course</hi> (opp. flexus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 38" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 38</bibl> Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> Limit. p. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Sicul. Fl. p. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 120 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 120 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41762.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 401</bibl></cit> (with durities): <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:4 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41762.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the stiffness</hi> produced by cold, for <hi rend="ital">cold</hi> itself, <hi rend="ital">chilliness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:368" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 368</bibl> (opp. calor); 307 (opp. ignis); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Alpinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septentrionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli et soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentissimus aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentibus rigore nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41762.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas, asperitas, morositas): accentus rigore quodam minus suaves habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 33</bibl></cit> (cf. rigidus, II. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">te tuus iste rigor, positique sine arte capilli ... decet,</quote> <trans><tr>rudeness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocuit antiquus rigor et nimia severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 19, 18, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 13</bibl> (opp. constantia): <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rigoratus: <entryFree id="n41763" type="hapax" key="ri^go_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rigor</etym>, <sense id="n41763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traduces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
riguus: <entryFree id="n41764" type="main" key="ri^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rigo</etym> (perh. not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n41764.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that waters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrigates;</hi> <hi rend="ital">watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrigating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vallibus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 485</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41764.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wellwatered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 646</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 797</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons scatebris fontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae plurimo lacte rigua bos est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>distended with milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">well-watered places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Babylonis rigua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83, § 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:247" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 26, 39, § 247</bibl>; so once in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ager), <hi rend="ital">a well-watered place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 26, 41, § 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rima: <entryFree id="n41765" type="main" key="ri_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for rigma, from rig, ringor; hence, that gapes, yawns</etym>, <sense id="n41765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fissure</hi> (cf. hiatus): <cit><quote lang="la">angusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 515</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae rimas agunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are cracked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rimas agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 512</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a like sense, ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: explere, <hi rend="ital">to stop up</hi>, Cic, Or. 69, 231; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te signata juvabunt Limina, persuasae fallere rima sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 146.— </sense><sense id="n41765.1" n="2" level="3"> = cunnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 97</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: ignea rima micans, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a flash of lightning</hi> (qs. cleaving the sky), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 392</bibl>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43</bibl>, <pb n="1596" /> <cb n="RIPA" /> § 112.—</sense><sense id="n41765.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, comically: plenus rimarum sum: hac atque hac perfluo, <hi rend="ital">I am full of chinks</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">can keep nothing to myself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 25</bibl> (opp. tacere, continere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rimabundus: <entryFree id="n41766" type="main" key="ri_ma_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rimor</etym>, <sense id="n41766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">examining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rimatim: <entryFree id="n41767" type="hapax" key="ri_ma_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>rima</etym>, <sense id="n41767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">through the chinks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculabunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rimator: <entryFree id="n41768" type="main" key="ri_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rimor</etym>, <sense id="n41768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an investigator</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rimo: <entryFree id="n41769" type="main" key="ri_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. rimor <sense id="n41769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rimor: <entryFree id="n41770" type="main" key="ri_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [rima]. </sense><sense id="n41770.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig. belonging to agricultural lang., <hi rend="ital">to lay open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn up</hi> the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">rastris terram rimantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 534</bibl></cit>.— Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to root up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grub through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres rimantur prata Caystri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna et paludes (volucres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem (sues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41770.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn over</hi> insearch of any thing; <hi rend="ital">to pry into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n41770.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur Viscera rimatur epulis,</quote> <trans><tr>rummages for food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspex Pectora pullorum rimatur et exta catelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:551" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum pilis et lanceis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes rimatur apertas, Qua vulnus letale ferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 748</bibl></cit>: oculis caeli plagas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 382, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 526</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">elatis naribus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rimatus fustem cunctis vastiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 141, 14</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuique repertum Rimanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 508</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41770.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to examine thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi> (syn.: scrutor, investigo, indago): hanc quidem rationem naturae difficile est fortasse traducere ad id genus divinationis; sed tamen id quoque rimatur quantum potest, Posidonius (the figure taken from the haruspices or augurs), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cuncta rimanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:14" default="NO">12, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 11 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41770.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego autem rimari non queo, unde hoc sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.?*! </sense><sense id="n41770.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 382, 10</bibl>; Poët. ap. Fest. s. v. ruspari, p. 265 Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n41770.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rī-mātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rimosus: <entryFree id="n41771" type="main" key="ri_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of cracks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chinks</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fissures</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n41771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 9), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium (with fissum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:270" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 270</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41771.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae rimosā bene deponuntur in aure,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that keeps nothing secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in eā (animā) rimosum est ac remissum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 1, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rimula: <entryFree id="n41772" type="main" key="ri_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small crack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chink</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fissure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl> (al. rimae): <cit><quote lang="la">cavernarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ringor: <entryFree id="n41773" type="main" key="ringor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ringor</orth>, <itype>rictus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open wide the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show the teeth</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n41773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: saltat ridens, ringitur, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 30</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 206 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n41773.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry; to chafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snarl</hi> (the fig. borrowed from a growling dog): <cit><quote lang="la">ille ringitur, tu rideas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">ringeris quoties aliquem in fastis saepius legeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapere et ringi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
