ripa: <entryFree id="n41774" type="main" key="ri_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. rivus</etym>, <sense id="n41774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bank</hi> of a stream (while litus is the coast, shore of the sea; v. Döderl. Syn. Part. 3, p. 208; freq. and class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 41 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ripas radentia flumina rodunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex utrāque parte ripae fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus urbem perennis amnis posuit in ripā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridissima gramine ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba ad ripas effusa ruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 591</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comically: ripis superat mihi atque abundat pectus laetitiā meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos mihi amnes estis, vestrā ripā vos sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41774.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the shore of the sea</hi>: villa semper mare recte conspicit ... numquam ex ripā, sed haud paulum submota a litore (sc. respergitur), <hi rend="ital">never</hi> (<hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>) <hi rend="ital">from the bank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi> (<hi rend="ital">rather</hi>) <hi rend="ital">a good way back from the shore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>: sentiant ... Aequoris nigri fremitum, et trementes Verbere<cb n="RITE" />  ripas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris ripa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ripaeus: <entryFree id="n41775" type="main" key="Ri_paeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rīpaeus</orth>, v. Rhip-.</entryFree>
riparienses: <entryFree id="n41776" type="main" key="ri_pa_ri^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpārĭenses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpārenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ripa</etym>, <sense id="n41776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">troops stationed on the bank of a river</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 38</bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 1, 18; 7, 4, 14.</sense></entryFree>
riparius: <entryFree id="n41777" type="main" key="ri_pa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that frequents the banks of rivers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundines,</quote> <trans><tr>bank-martins</tr>, <tr>sand-martins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ripensis: <entryFree id="n41778" type="main" key="ri_pensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stationed on a river</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s bank</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dacia,</quote> <trans><tr>on the bank of the Danube</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: milites, = riparienses, Cod. Th. 7, 20, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, militia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ripeus: <entryFree id="n41779" type="main" key="Ri_peus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rīpeus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rīphaeus</orth>, v. Rhiph-.</entryFree>
ripheus: <entryFree id="n41780" type="main" key="Ri_pheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rīpheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi, and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 352</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ripula: <entryFree id="n41781" type="hapax" key="ri_pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ripa</etym>, <sense id="n41781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">margin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl>, B.</sense></entryFree>
riscus: <entryFree id="n41782" type="greek" key="riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">riscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(i/skos,</foreign> <sense id="n41782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
risibilis: <entryFree id="n41783" type="main" key="ri_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rideo</etym>, <sense id="n41783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can laugh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">risible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 398</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
risiloquium: <entryFree id="n41784" type="main" key="ri_si^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>risus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n41784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tattling and laughing at the same time</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poenit. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
risio: <entryFree id="n41785" type="hapax" key="ri_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rideo</etym>, <sense id="n41785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laughing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot risiones!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
risito: <entryFree id="n41786" type="hapax" key="ri_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to laugh over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> any thing: dicta risitantes, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 209, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
risor: <entryFree id="n41787" type="main" key="ri_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laugher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banterer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 225</bibl>; Firm. Math. 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
risus: <entryFree id="n41788" type="main" key="ri_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laughing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh</hi> (equally freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">risum movere ... quid sit risus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:235 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 235 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the whole chapter, De risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui risum magis quam stomachum movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">risum judicis movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus populi factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: risus facere, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miros risus nos edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (10), 2; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ne spissae risum tollant coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus captare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">risum captare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48" default="NO">8, 3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocris quidam est risus consecutus non in te, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam tabulam magni risus consequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam sum ejus magno hominum risu cavillatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit> (12), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">risu cognoscere matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara lento Temperet risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditor Gratus puellae risus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">risui sorori fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:4" default="NO">44, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis aegre risum continui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo risu me admoderarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risu emoriri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: risu clandestino rumpier, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde oriebantur risus dulcesque cachinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene ille timore, ego risu corrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (10), 2.— </sense><sense id="n41788.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an object of laughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus omnibus risus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:438" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 438</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41788.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a practical joke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mockery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per jocum deos inridens, jussit, etc.... qui risus populo cladem attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41788.3" n="3" level="3"> Personified, as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rite: <entryFree id="n41789" type="main" key="ri_te^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rītĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perh. an old <case>abl.</case> form collat. with ritu, as, on the other hand, diu with die, and noctu with nocte; <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> rite = ritu, is now found only in rite nefasto libatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:285" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 285</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n41789.0" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">according to religious ceremonies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">observances;</hi> and pregn., <hi rend="ital">with due religious observances</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to religious usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna mulierum sacrificia ne sunto praeter olla quae pro populo rite fient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite veteres, rite etiam vestri coluere divos, id. poët. Div. 1, 13, 21: neque duobus nisi certis deis rite una hostia fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequiis rite solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum mactabat rite bidentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos apprecati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latonae puerum canentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus divinis perpetratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora sacrificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa sacerdotum rite dicata manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:610" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 610</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41789.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">in a proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just manner; fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fit rite id ratum ac rectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.: rite significat bene ac recte, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=272" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 272</bibl> ib.: idque ut <cb n="RITU" /> rite intellegas te facere, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P.: hunc deum rite beatum dixerimus, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with justice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 52</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 264</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 433 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creatus tribunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus paratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens rite Nutrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maxima Juno Rite vocor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVON RITE RECTE DE FINIBVS CVM VELIENS. ACTVM SIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos veneror, Ut, quod de meā re huc veni, rite venerim,</quote> <trans><tr>at the right time</tr>, <tr>fortunately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 254</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphas venerabar, Rite secundarent visus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41789.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In the usual way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fashion; according to custom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinentes pocula rite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campestres Scythae, Quorum plaustra vagas rite trahunt domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religatos rite videbat Carpere gramen equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 352</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41789.3" n="c" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">in the manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form prescribed by law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">legally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemnly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic enim rite productust patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite creatus tribunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium rite confectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ritualis: <entryFree id="n41790" type="main" key="ri_tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rītŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ritus</etym>, <sense id="n41790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to religious rites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ceremonies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ritual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rituales nominantur Etruscorum libri, in quibus praescriptum est, quo ritu condantur urbes, arae, aedes sacrentur, quā sanctitate muri, quo jure portae, quomodo tribus, curiae, centuriae distribuantur, exercitus constituantur, ordinentur ceteraque ejusmodi ad bellum ac pacem pertinentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=285" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 285 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rītŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">ceremonial rites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rītŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to religious usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with religious ceremonies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritualiter consecrata mensula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ritus: <entryFree id="n41791" type="main" key="ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n41791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> rituis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 30</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> rite nefasto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:285" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 285</bibl>; v. rite), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. unknown</etym>, orig. belonging to relig. lang. </sense><sense id="n41791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the form and manner of religious observances; a religious usage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ceremony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rite</hi> (cf. caerimonia): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeco ritu sacra non Romano facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra diis aliis Albano ritu, Graeco Herculi facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo haec privatim et publice modo rituque flant, discunto ignari a publicis sacerdotibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">morem ritusque sacrorum Adiciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de more rituque priscae religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex patriis ritibus optuma colunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates, quae populi Romani ritibus consecratae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina dei (sc. Bacchi) Ritibus instruitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificos docuit ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:483" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profanos ritus exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrari magico ritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 398</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41791.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus, mos vel consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 289</bibl> ib. </sense><sense id="n41791.3" n="a" level="4"> Usually in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> and with a foll. <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fashion of</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n41791.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">more ferarum Quadrupedumque ritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pecudum ritu ad voluptatem omnia referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudum, ferarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latronum vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis (petiisse laurum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae (cincta, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 695</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 536</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hominis sed accipitris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri ritu flammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41791.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mulier cantherino ritu astans somniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritu barbarico esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res quaeque suo ritu procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:923" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 923</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novo Sublime moliar atrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleatorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rancida quo perolent projecta cadavera ritu,</quote> <trans><tr>in the way that</tr>, <tr>such as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41791.6" n="b" level="4"> In other cases (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognosse Sabinae Gentis ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre Cyclopum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:500" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienos ritus mores legesque verti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus dissimiles habuere duo examina apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moresque tractamus innumeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externas caerimonias, Aegyptios Judiacosque ritus compescuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:40" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ritu nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23</bibl></cit>, tit. 2. <pb n="1597" /> <cb n="RIXA" /></sense></entryFree>
rivalicius: <entryFree id="n41792" type="hapax" key="ri_va_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvālīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rivalis</etym>, <sense id="n41792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to those who make use of the same brook</hi>: lex, Fest. s. v. sifus, p. 240 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
rivalis: <entryFree id="n41793" type="main" key="ri_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rivus</etym>. <sense id="n41793.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a brook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brook-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n41793.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those who have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">use the same brook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41793.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inter rivales, id est qui per eundem rivum aquam ducunt, sit contentio de aquae usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1:section=26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 1, § 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:3:section=5" default="NO">43, 20, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41793.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rī-vālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has the same mistress as another; a competitor</hi> in love, <hi rend="ital">a rival</hi>: eadem est amica ambobus; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivales sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:Grex 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. Grex 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 57, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 10 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem ego rivalem recipiendum censeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 539</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 791</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41793.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: se amare sine rivali, <hi rend="ital">to be fond of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self without a rival</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be alone in esteeming one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o di, quam ineptus! quam se ipse amans sine rivali!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sine rivali te et tua solus amares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 444</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rivalitas: <entryFree id="n41794" type="main" key="ri_va_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rivalis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n41794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rivalship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rivalry</hi> in love (cf. aemulatio, rivalry in gen.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">between women,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 16</bibl></cit>: rivalitatem non amat victoria, P. Syri Sent. 575 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
rivatim: <entryFree id="n41795" type="main" key="ri_va_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>rivus</etym>, <sense id="n41795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a brook</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brooks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluunt aquae de Ponto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rivifinalis: <entryFree id="n41796" type="main" key="ri_vi^fi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvĭfīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rivus-finis</etym>, <sense id="n41796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bounded by a brook</hi>: tractus, Sicul. Flacc p. 12 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
rivinus: <entryFree id="n41797" type="gloss" key="ri_vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvīnus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/zhlos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. (i. q. rivalis).</entryFree>
rivo: <entryFree id="n41798" type="hapax" key="ri_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rivus</etym>, <sense id="n41798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes in atria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 28, 614</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rivora: <entryFree id="n41799" type="main" key="ri_vo^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvŏra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rivulets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drains</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 235</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">237</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">258</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
rivosus: <entryFree id="n41800" type="main" key="ri_vo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ rīvōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">r(eidw/dhs,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
rivulus: <entryFree id="n41801" type="main" key="ri_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rivus</etym>, <sense id="n41801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small brook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rivulet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Almonis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 160; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 20, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cant. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41801.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in Cic., who, on the other hand, uses rivus in the lit. sense): <cit><quote lang="la">influxit non tenuis quidam e Graeciā rivulus in hanc urbem, sed abundantissimus amnis illarum disciplinarum et artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivulos consectari, fontes rerum non videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>; so (opp. fontes) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 19</bibl> (but the correct read. is ramuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
rivus: <entryFree id="n41802" type="main" key="ri_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root ri- (li-), to flow, drop; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh;</foreign> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cf</orth>. liris; Sanscr. rīna, flowing; cf. ripa</etym>, <sense id="n41802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small stream of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brook</hi> (cf.: fluvius, amnis). </sense><sense id="n41802.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rivus est locus per longitudinem depressus, quo aqua decurrat, cui nomen est <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ tou= r(ei=n,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 21</bibl> (de rivis), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">rivorum a fonte deductio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostrati in gramine molli Propter aquae rivum,</quote> <trans><tr>by a waterbrook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1392</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia flumina atque omnes rivos, qui ad mare pertinebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; cf. 3, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 29, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">celeres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudite jam rivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis fugiens per gramina rivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: e rivo flumina magna facere, <hi rend="ital">to magnify an insignificant object;</hi> or, as we say, <hi rend="ital">to make a mountain of a mole-hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41802.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41802.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An artificial water-course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:61" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:15" default="NO">8, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:11" default="NO">8, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41802.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A gutter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl> (7), 1 al.—</sense><sense id="n41802.5" n="2" level="3"> Of other liquids, <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">manabat venis ferventibus argenti rivus et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis uberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 668</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivis currentia vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41802.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">v. rivulus, II.): liquidus fortunae rivus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: facundiae rivus, Lact. Opif. Dei, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rixa: <entryFree id="n41803" type="main" key="rixa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root rig, whence ringor; the suffix -sa like noxa from noc-eo; hence, prop., the wide opening of the <cb n="ROBI" /> mouth</etym>. <sense id="n41803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quarrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contention</hi> (class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: contentio, altercatio, disceptatio, jurgium): ecce nova turba atque rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa ac prope proelium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa sedata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rixā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rixam ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive geris jocos Seu rixam et insanos amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa super mero Debellata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Academiae nostrae cum Zenone magna rixa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatis rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:37:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia primum, mox rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrupta jurgiis aut rixis disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: a lasso rixam quaeri, v. lassus.—</sense><sense id="n41803.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">major cum Oceano quam cum ipsis navibus rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of beasts: deque tuo fiet ... Insatiabilibus corpore rixa lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:170" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rixator: <entryFree id="n41804" type="main" key="rixa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rixa</etym>, <sense id="n41804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarrelsome person; a brawler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl>; Firm. Math. 5.</sense></entryFree>
rixatorius: <entryFree id="n41805" type="main" key="rixa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a quarrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contentious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud (with jurgiosum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. M. Caes. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. M. Caes. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rixo: <entryFree id="n41806" type="main" key="rixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. rixor <sense id="n41806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rixor: <entryFree id="n41807" type="main" key="rixor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [rixa], <hi rend="ital">to quarrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41807.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multo cum sanguine saepe rixantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1286</bibl></cit>: cum esset cum eo de amiculā rixatus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lanā caprinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pugnat sed rixatur (orator),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixantis modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:9" default="NO">6, 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41807.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to oppose; to clash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herbae) dum tenerae sunt vellendae, prius enim aridae factae rixantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>offer resistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami arborum inter se,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to grow across each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantes asperiores in commissura verborum rixantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ore concurrente rixari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 121</bibl></cit> (for which, colluctatio); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121:section=56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 121, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum theatro saeculoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:27:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum inter se non rixentur cupiditas et timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 5</bibl></cit>.?*! <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rixo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 22 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rixosus: <entryFree id="n41808" type="main" key="rixo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rixōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugnacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=291" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 291</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
robeus: <entryFree id="n41809" type="main" key="ro^beus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏbeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. rubeus.</entryFree>
robigalia: <entryFree id="n41810" type="main" key="Ro_bi_ga_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōbīgālĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rūbīg-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Robigus</etym>, <sense id="n41810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yearly festival held in honor of Robigus on the 25th of April</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 16</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:284 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 284 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=267" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 267</bibl> Müll.; Calend. Praen. s. h. d.; Inscr. Orell. II. pp. 388 and 389; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
robigino: <entryFree id="n41811" type="hapax" key="ro_bi_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbīgĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rūbīg-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>robigo</etym>, <sense id="n41811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to contract rust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
robiginosus: <entryFree id="n41812" type="main" key="ro_bi_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbīgĭnōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rūbīg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rusty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41812.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">strigilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius (opp. splendidus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Eloq. p. 230" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Eloq. p. 230</bibl></cit> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">telum sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 45, 6</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41812.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubiginosis dentibus cuncta rodit,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>envious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:28:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
robigo: <entryFree id="n41813" type="main" key="ro_bi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rūb-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>robus = ruber; formed like aerugo, ferrugo</etym>, <sense id="n41813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rust</hi> of metals. </sense><sense id="n41813.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem pol e robigine, non e ferro factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exesa inveniet scabra robigine pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsā laedit robigine ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non rubigo ulla, non aerugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41813.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41813.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouldiness</hi>, on grain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 16</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 13</bibl>; id. poët. 10, 342; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:279" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 69, § 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 7 al.</bibl>; cf. Robigus and Robigalia.— </sense><sense id="n41813.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The deposit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">that collects on millstones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 30, § 136</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">on the teeth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 776</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 802</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 515</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">an ulcer in a wound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 76</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulcer</hi>, produced by lewdness, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 151</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41813.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rust</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium longa rubigine laesum Torpet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:7" default="NO">7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridae vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.— As personified, v. Robigus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="ROBU" /></sense></entryFree>
robigus: <entryFree id="n41814" type="main" key="Ro_bi_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōbīgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rūbīg-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōbī-go</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>robigo, I. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n41814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a god of the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who averted mildew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 16</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=267" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 267</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 14</bibl>; cf. Robigalia.— Acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:907" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 907</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 17</bibl>, this was <hi rend="ital">a female deity</hi>, and was called Robigo.</sense></entryFree>
roborarium: <entryFree id="n41815" type="hapax" key="ro_bo^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>robur</etym>, <sense id="n41815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosure for animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built of oaken boards</hi> (= vivarium), Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 20, 5 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
roborasco: <entryFree id="n41816" type="hapax" key="ro_bo^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to grow strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: ramus (pueri), Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 26</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 218 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
roboratus: <entryFree id="n41817" type="main" key="ro_bo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of roboro.</entryFree>
roboreus: <entryFree id="n41818" type="main" key="ro_bo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>robur</etym>, <sense id="n41818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:622" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:2" default="NO">6, 30, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
roboro: <entryFree id="n41819" type="main" key="ro_bo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make strong; to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n41819.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1038</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum largo cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidos stramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 260</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41819.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatem perpetuā constantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia exercitatione plurimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">28: recti cultus pectora roborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">educata hujus nutrimentis eloquentia ipsa se postea colorat et roborat,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes strong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 11, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">strengthened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">roboratior exitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Cont. Pel. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
roborosus: <entryFree id="n41820" type="main" key="ro_bo^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <trans><tr>a cramp</tr>, <tr>spasm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetanici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
robur: <entryFree id="n41821" type="main" key="ro_bur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbur</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbor</orth>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 140</bibl> Lachm.; also an older form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=264" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 264</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. radh-as, abundance; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(w/nnumi</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">r(w/qnumi,</foreign> to strengthen, <foreign lang="greek">r(w/mh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n41821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very hard kind of oak</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus, ilex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:186" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 38, 73, § 186</bibl>; 16, 40, 76, § 204; 16, 40, 77, § 218.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n41821.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41821.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a very hard kind of tree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus roboris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the wild olive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 783</bibl></cit> (a little before: foliis oleaster amaris Hic steterat); <cit><quote lang="la">so of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 305</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solido de robore myrtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annoso validam robore quercum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of an old and sturdy trunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 441</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">annoso robore quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquo robore quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>with ancient trunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massyla, i. e. citri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Maurorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41821.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, usu., <hi rend="ital">an oak-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oak</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fixa est pariter cum robore cervix,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was pinned fast to the oak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitata robora pulsant (delphines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 303</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41821.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Oak-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves totae factae ex robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sapiens) non est e saxo sculptus aut e robore dolatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>; and with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi robur et aes triplex Circa pectus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o saxis nimirum et robore nati!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 340</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41821.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41821.6" n="A" level="2"> Of things made of oak or of any other hard wood. </sense><sense id="n41821.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii cottidianis epulis in robore accumbunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on oaken</tr>, <tr>hard benches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>.— So of <hi rend="ital">the wooden horse</hi> before Troy: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 230</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">a lance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro praefixum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:244" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:267" default="NO">267</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a club</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:44:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 44, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aratri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the oaken plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:555" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 555</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41821.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the lower and stronger part of the prison at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Servius Tullius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was called</hi> Robur (also Tullianum): <cit><quote lang="la">Robus in carcere dicitur is locus, quo praecipitatur maleficorum genus, quod ante arcis robusteis includebatur, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. robum, p. 264 Müll.: in robore et tenebris exspiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur et saxum minitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera, carnifices, robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 19</bibl> (v. carcer and Tullianum).—</sense><sense id="n41821.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> (cf. vires; v. Fabri ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n41821.10" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duri robora ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 449</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30</bibl></cit>: omnia pariter crescunt et robora sumunt, <hi rend="ital">gain strength</hi>, <pb n="1598" /> <cb n="ROBU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 820</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:895" default="NO" valid="yes">895</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si jam satis aetatis atque roboris haberet, ipse pro Sex. Roscio diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum jam roboris accessit aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidaeque suo stant robore vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 639</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod est robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41821.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">alter virtutis robore firmior quam aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animi excelsi atque invicti magnitudine ac robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi (with magnitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 343</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur incredibile animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 37, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in cujusque animo roboris est ac nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo plus firmamenti ac roboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so (with firmamentum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 58</bibl>; (with firmitas) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi tot equites Romani quid roboris hujus petitioni attulerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus robore fultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te mea robora fallunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitate pari, robore animi virumque praestanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba quanti roboris plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui robur aliquod in stilo fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">robur oratorium adicere sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: illi robur et aes triplex Circa pectus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">O saxis nimirum et robore nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 340</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41821.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Authority</hi>: nostrarum constitutionum, Just. Inst. prooem. 6.— </sense><sense id="n41821.13" n="c" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the strongest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most effective</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">best part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kernel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi> of any thing; of soldiers, the <hi rend="ital">flower</hi> of the troops, <hi rend="ital">choice troops</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">versaris in optimorum civium vel flore vel robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: et robur et suboles militum interiit, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fuit roboris, duobus proeliis interiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod roboris ea provincia habuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:454 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 454 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc C. Flavius Pusio, Cn. Titinnius, C.
