Maecenas, illa robora populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:56:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 56, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt nostra robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 54</bibl>; 22, 6; 23, 16; 25, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora pubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 510</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentia robora virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferta robora virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: betae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">stalks</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 326. — Of a place, <hi rend="ital">a stronghold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod coloniam virium et opum validam robur ac sedem bello legisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: robus, <hi rend="ital">the name of an excellent kind of wheat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam et pondere et nitore praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
roburneus: <entryFree id="n41822" type="hapax" key="ro_burne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōburnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>robur</etym>, <sense id="n41822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oaks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
robus: <entryFree id="n41823" type="main" key="ro_bus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, v. robur <sense id="n41823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41824" type="main" key="ro^bus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. rubeus.</entryFree>
robuste: <entryFree id="n41825" type="main" key="ro_buste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. robustus <sense id="n41825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
robusteus: <entryFree id="n41826" type="main" key="ro_buste^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbustĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>robur</etym>, <sense id="n41826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">other hard wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
robustus: <entryFree id="n41827" type="main" key="ro_bustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41827.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of oakwood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit> et saep.: carcer (referring to the Robur in the Roman carcer; <cit><quote lang="la">v. robur, II. A. 2.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">codex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41827.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lusty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robust</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: valens, nervosus). </sense><sense id="n41827.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans><tr>hearty</tr>, <tr>nourishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustior cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 46, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:298" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 30, 72, § 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustissima terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustissimum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">24: robustissima oppida,</quote> <trans><tr>strongly fortified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. of persons: robusti et valentes satellites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">transit in aestatem post ver robustior annus, Fitque valens juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu atque aetate robustior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 16, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustiores vinum bibere, infirmiores aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderator aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 933</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1253" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1253</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer acri militiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore amplo atque robusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustissima juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41827.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, etc.: facilius quod est propositum consequar, si nostram rem, publicam vobis et nascentem et crescentem et adultam et jam firmam atque <cb n="ROGA" /> robustam ostendero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidam et robustam et assiduam frequentiam praebuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res vetustate robustas calumniando pervertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">robusta et solida eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robusta et stabilis fortitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveteratum (malum) fit plerumque robustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae robustioris improbitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus (with magna constantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 17, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōbustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, Naz. Pan. ad Constant. 17.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rodo: <entryFree id="n41828" type="main" key="ro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. rado</etym>, <sense id="n41828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnaw</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41828.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rutabulum, Novat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 226 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeos, etc. (mures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: praetextam, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dente pollicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem (caper),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:357" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias (mures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosus tineis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41828.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to eat away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas (flumina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum (robigo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tophum (calx),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41828.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to backbite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>, etc. (syn. vellico): <cit><quote lang="la">in conviviis rodunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentem amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertino patre natum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta robiginosis dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:28:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem dente,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to speak ill of each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: murmura secum et rabiosa silentia rodunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to mutter to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:81" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rodus: <entryFree id="n41829" type="main" key="ro_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōdus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōduscŭlum</orth>, v. raud-.</entryFree>
rogalis: <entryFree id="n41830" type="main" key="ro^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rogus</etym>, <sense id="n41830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a funeral pile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rogamentum: <entryFree id="n41831" type="main" key="ro^ga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rogo</etym>, <sense id="n41831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a question</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 31, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rogatio: <entryFree id="n41832" type="main" key="ro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41832.0" n="I" level="1"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">an inquiry of the people as to whether they will decree this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proposal to the people for passing a law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proposed law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (rogatio) de Pompeio a Gellio et a Lentulo consulibus lata est,</quote> <trans><tr>was proposed</tr>, <tr>presented</tr>, <tr>introduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus lege aut rogatione civitas aut libertas erepta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:84:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 84, 100</bibl></cit> Halm ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem ferre de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dissuasione rogationis ejus, quae contra coloniam Narbonensem ferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso lator rogationis idem erat dissuasor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem promulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">promulgantur uno eodemque tempore rogationes ab eodem tribuno de meā pernicie et de provinciis consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasit rogationem,</quote> <trans><tr>recommended</tr>, <tr>spoke in favor of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercedere rogationi,</quote> <trans><tr>to oppose it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to accept it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: rogationes jubere (opp. antiquare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vim rogationem perferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum provocatione rogationem pertulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitare rogationis carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 64, 10</bibl></cit>. — The formula made use of in such a rogation runs thus, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 9</bibl>: velitis jubeatis uti, etc. (here follows the proposed law; at the close): haec ita uti dixi ita vos Quirites rogo.— </sense><sense id="n41832.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., </sense><sense id="n41832.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogation</hi>, only as a figure of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatio atque huic finitima quasi percontatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 29</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41832.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demanding; a prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ego Curtium non modo rogatione sed etiam testimonio tuo diligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rogatiuncula: <entryFree id="n41833" type="main" key="ro^ga_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rogatio</etym>. * <sense id="n41833.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An unimportant bill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proposed law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 51</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41833.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rogator: <entryFree id="n41834" type="main" key="ro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rogo</etym>. <sense id="n41834.0" n="I" level="1"> In publicists' lang., * </sense><sense id="n41834.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who proposes a law to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the proposer of a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presenter of a bill</hi>: legum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 383, 14</bibl> (v. infra, II. A.). — </sense><sense id="n41834.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An officer in the voting</hi> <cb n="ROGO" /> <hi rend="ital">comitia who asked the people for their votes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collector of votes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a polling-clerk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justus comitiorum rogator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos rogatores, vos diribitores, vos custodes fuisse tabularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41834.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., * </sense><sense id="n41834.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who makes a proposal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proposer</hi> (in allusion to the signif. I. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec epistula non suasoris est sed rogatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, 9. — </sense><sense id="n41834.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beggar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mendicant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:30:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 30, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:4" default="NO">10, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rogatus: <entryFree id="n41835" type="main" key="ro^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rogo</etym>, <sense id="n41835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi> (Ciceron.; only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Chilius te rogat et ego ejus rogatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 36, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rogitatio: <entryFree id="n41836" type="hapax" key="ro^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rogito</etym>, instead of the usual rogatio, <sense id="n41836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proposed law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitationes plurumas propter vos populus scivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rogito: <entryFree id="n41837" type="main" key="ro^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>rogo</etym>, <sense id="n41837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire with eagerness</hi> (a favorite word with Plaut. and Ter.; <cit><quote lang="la">otherwise very rare): rogitando sum raucus factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitant me, ut valeam, quid agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me id rogites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum hoc simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <trans><tr>to inquire for fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa super Priamo rogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 750</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 839</bibl> (the correct read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 35</bibl>, is rogare, Umpfenb., Fleck.).</sense></entryFree>
rogo: <entryFree id="n41838" type="main" key="ro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n41838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. rogarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogassint, for rogaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. for progo; kindr. with Sanscr. prac, to ask, whence also precor and procus, but referred by Corss. to the same root with Sanscr. rgus, straight; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)re/gw;</foreign> Lat. rego, rex, rogus, Krit. Beit. p. 93</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogate</hi> one about a thing. </sense><sense id="n41838.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41838.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (so generally throughout ante-class. Lat.; less. freq. in Cic.; syn.: percontor, sciscitor, quaero), constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>, or simply <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 393). (<hi rend="ital">a</hi>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquid</hi> (class. only with <hi rend="ital">acc. of neutr. pron.</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos>, or with <hi rend="ital">sententiam;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliud te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud istuc te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu id me rogas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te rogo, quos locos adisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogare hoc unum te volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi hoc, quod te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 64</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 12 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego patriam te rogo, quae sit tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (colubram) alia cum rogaret causam facinoris, Respondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41838.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego igitur rogem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem hominem tu novisti? te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; men' or me rogas? also, rogas me? in colloq. lang., <hi rend="ital">do you ask that of me? how can you ask? what do you mean by asking that? Eu.</hi> Quid ego facerem? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quid tu faceres? men' rogas? requireres, Rogitares, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 31 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me istud rogas? inquam: Stoicos roga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod rogo responde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 12 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41838.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam de istoc rogare omitte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de istac virgine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de te ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41838.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogant me servi, quo eam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: roga ipsum, quemadmodum ego eum Arimini acceperim, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 383, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi me populus Romanus forte roget, cur Non, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit, rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo, num quid velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavi pervenissetne Agrigentum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde venis? et Quo tendis? rogat et respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid verum atque decens curo et rogo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>. — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius respondes quam rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roganti respondebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol nunc, ubi terrarum, sim, scio, si quis roget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu ergo rogas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ty.</hi> Quid ego deliqui? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Rogas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 32 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 59</bibl>: etiam rogas?<pb n="1599" /> <cb n="ROGO" />  <hi rend="ital">do you dare to ask?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 23</bibl> (v. etiam). — Particularly as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam nobis ad rogatum respondent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 4, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41838.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (class. in all per.). </sense><sense id="n41838.7" n="1" level="3"> Publicists' t. t. </sense><sense id="n41838.8" n="a" level="4"> Rogare aliquem (sententiam), <hi rend="ital">to ask one for his opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vote</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Racilius Marcellinum primum rogavit. Is sententiam dixit, ut, etc.... Postea Racilius de privatis me primum sententiam rogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos priores sententiam rogabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 35</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes ante me rogati gratias Caesari egissent, ego rogatus mutavi meum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scito primum me non esse rogatum sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus rogatus sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is enim primus rogatus sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:97 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 97 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter ipsam rem, de quā sententiae rogantur, consultabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41838.9" n="b" level="4"> Rogare populum or legem, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, prop., <hi rend="ital">to ask the people about a law;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring the plan of a law before the people for their approval; to propose a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce a bill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aes incidi jubebitis credo illa legitima: consules populum jure rogaverunt populusque jure scivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: T. Quinctius Crispinus consul populum jure rogavit populusque jure scivit in foro pro rostris ... quicumque post hanc legem rogatam rivos, specus, etc., an old legal formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (leges) non in perpetuum rogentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hanc legem, uti rogas, jubendam censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 35</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc rogari, ut populus consules creet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41838.10" n="c" level="4"> Rogare populum magistratum, and simply magistratum, <hi rend="ital">to propose a magistrate to the people for their choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer him for election</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum senatus consultum, ut duo viros aediles ex patribus dictator populum rogaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Trebonius tribunus plebis rogationem tulit, ut qui plebem Romanam tribunos plebi rogaret, is usque eo rogaret dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) volet, ut consules roget praetor vel dictatorem dicat: quorum neutrum jus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores, cum ita rogentur, ut collegae consulibus sint, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodieque in legibus magistratibusque rogandis usurpatur idem jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia consulibus rogandis habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calpurnius Romam ad magistratus rogandos proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 6</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuo rege Pompilio Tullum Hostilium populus regem, interrege rogante, comitiis curiatis creavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41838.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: rogare milites sacramento, qs. <hi rend="ital">to ask the soldiers if they will take and keep an oath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bind them by an oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer an oath to them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 40, 26; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 26</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41838.12" n="3" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi> a person <hi rend="ital">if he will promise</hi> something in making an agreement; <hi rend="ital">to propose a stipulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fere novissimā parte pactorum ita solet inseri: rogavit Titius, spopondit Maevius, haec verba non tantum pactionis loco accipiuntur sed etiam stipulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:14:7:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 14, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 37</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n41838.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi> one for a thing (so predominantly in the class. per.; syn.: posco, oro, obsecro, ambio, capto); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (rarely <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo</hi>) <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41838.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā confidentiā rogare argentum me tantum audes, Impudens? Quin si egomet totus veneam, vix recipi potis est, Quod tu me rogas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te vehementer etiam atque etiam rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas sit tale aliquid et facere rogatum et rogare ... Haec igitur lex in amicitiā sanciatur, ut neque rogemus res turpes nec faciamus rogati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39 sq.</bibl></cit>: otium divos rogat, Hor. c. 2, 16, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:77:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Metello missionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab avunculo rogetur Aethiops,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo te, vos, etc., parenthet.: rogo te, videte, quibus hominibus negotium detis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo vos, quis potest sine offulā vivere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae Priami rogantis Achillem preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: taurum de aquā per fundum<cb n="ROMA" />  ejus ducenda rogabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiuntur, rogantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are asked for their votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi precario essent rogandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transisse Rhenum sese non suā sponte sed rogatum et arcessitum a Gallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ab Sardis rogatus ad causam accesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximum annum consulatum peteres, vel potius rogares ... a quā (Galliā) nos tum, cum consulatus petebatur, non rogabatur, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>was not begged for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abii ad praetorem, rogo syngraphum: Datur mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos ad Caesarem mittunt rogatum auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab aliquo (rare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum, securim, etc. ... Quae utenda vasa semper vicini rogant,</quote> <trans><tr>ask for</tr>, <tr>borrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41838.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">scitin' quid ego vos rogo? mihi ut praeconium detis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ut facias, vehementer te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam atque etiam te rogo atque oro, ut eum juves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogat et orat Dolabellam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:29:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rogat et prece cogit Scilicet ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, C, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbatur rogare, scalas ut darem utendas sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>that I would lend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 28, 3</bibl>.— With a simple final clause without <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar consolatus rogat, finem orandi faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO">9, 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:643" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 643</bibl>; and very freq. ap. Plin. Ep.; e. g. 1, 2, 1; 1, 5, 8; 1, 20, 24; 2, 5, 2; 3, 2, 6; 5, 19, 8; 7, 6, 11; 8, 17, 6.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogat frater, ne abeas longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac te illud primum rogabo, ne quid invitus meā causā facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41838.16" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: neque enim ego sic rogabam, ut petere viderer, quia familiaris esset meus (Plancus), etc., <hi rend="ital">did not solicit in such a way as to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 10, 25</bibl> (differing from <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">in blandiendo, rogando lenis et summissa (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem et filium pro vitā rogantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41838.17" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ask a visit</hi> from any one: <cit><quote lang="la">Tertia aderit, modo ne Publius rogatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomponiam Terentia rogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Palatium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heliog. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41838.18" n="c" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">malo emere quam rogare, of a thing that does not cost much,</quote> <trans><tr>I had rather buy than borrow it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>; cf. supra, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign> — </sense><sense id="n41838.19" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam hinc de proximo rogabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus (purpurae) exemplum aliunde rogabo, tibi quod ostendam (cf.: exemplum quaeritent, etc., in context),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rogus: <entryFree id="n41839" type="main" key="ro^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 24</bibl>; cf. Com. Rel. p. 153 Rib.). <sense id="n41839.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral pile</hi> (syn. bustum): ROGVM ASCIA NE POLITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena rogorum insuper exstructa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1283</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rogum illatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere in rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in rogum imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum exstruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo illata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portari in rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 640</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">646</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 189</bibl> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffugiunt avidos carmina sola rogos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>escape destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41839.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the grave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obserat umbrosos lurida porta rogos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 8.</sense></entryFree>
roma: <entryFree id="n41840" type="main" key="Ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rw/mh,</foreign> <sense id="n41840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Rome</hi>, founded in the second year of the seventh Olympiad (B. C. 753), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">worshipped as a goddess in a particular temple,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 52</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps urbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ROMAE AETERNAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1762</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1776</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1799</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ROMAE ET AVGVSTO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 606</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41840.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: forum, v. h. v.: populus Romanus (always in this order; abbreviated P. R.); v. populus: Juno, <hi rend="ital">the Roman</hi> (opp. Argiva), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>: lingua Romana, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Latin</hi>, Laurea Tull. poët. <cb n="RORO" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl>; Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 28, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 167:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 167, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae Romanae (= litterae Latinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:8" default="NO">6, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO">10, 1, 100</bibl>; 123: auctores. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Ver. Imp. p. 125" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Ver. Imp. p. 125</bibl>: ludi, also called ludi magni, <hi rend="ital">the most ancient in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annually celebrated on the</hi> 4<hi rend="ital">th of September</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 38</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romano more,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Roman manner</tr>, <tr>plainly</tr>, <tr>openly</tr>, <tr>candidly</tr>, <tr>frankly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 16, 3</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n41840.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 3, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41840.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Roman</hi> (sc. imperator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 59, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus sedendo vincit (cf. Q. Fabius Maximus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41840.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani,</quote> <trans><tr>the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Roman manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 2</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Romanism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Roman way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41840.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratra, juga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>made in Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 135, 2</bibl></cit>, § 3.—</sense><sense id="n41840.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rō-mānĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 162</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānen-ses</orth>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Corinthienses, p. 61, 1 Müll. — </sense><sense id="n41840.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmānŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L 5:section=164" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L 5, § 164</bibl></cit> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n41840.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rō-mĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=56" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 56</bibl></cit> Müll.; Fest. pp. 270 and 271 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
romularis: <entryFree id="n41841" type="main" key="Ro_mu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 1, Romulus, C.</entryFree>
romuleus: <entryFree id="n41842" type="main" key="Ro_mu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Romulus, A.</entryFree>
romulia: <entryFree id="n41843" type="main" key="Ro_mu^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĭa</orth>, <itype>tribus</itype>, v. Roma, E.</entryFree>
romulidae: <entryFree id="n41844" type="main" key="Ro_mu^li^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. 1. Romulus, D.</entryFree>
romulus: <entryFree id="n41845" type="main" key="Ro_mu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the founder and first king of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped after his death as</hi> Quirinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 31</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n41845.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĕus</orth> (Romuleus, Auct. Perv. Ven. 72), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Romulus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:260" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 654</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans><tr>the she-wolf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 104</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41845.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Romulus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:412" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 26: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>Roman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 877</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:793" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 793</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41845.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Romulus</hi>: ficus; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ruminalis: populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n41845.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the posterity of Romulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41846" type="main" key="Ro_mu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Romulus, B.</entryFree>
rorarii: <entryFree id="n41847" type="main" key="ro_ra_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ros</etym> (sc. milites), <sense id="n41847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of light-armed Roman troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who usually made the first attack and then retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skirmishers</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velites, ferentarii): rorarii dicti ab rore, qui bellum committebant ante, ideo quod ante rorat quam pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 58</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. h. v. p. 264 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 552 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9, 14</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; cf. Becker, Antiq. III. 2, p. 275.—In <number>sing.</number>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 2 sq.</bibl>—Hence, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrārĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the</hi> rorarii: <cit><quote lang="la">rorarium vinum, quod rorariis dabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=267" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 267</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
roratio: <entryFree id="n41848" type="main" key="ro_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>roro</etym>, <sense id="n41848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling of dew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41848.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41848.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41848.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The falling off of the grape in consequence of a cold dew</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a disease of the grapes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 226</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41848.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dropping in the clepsydra</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rorescit: <entryFree id="n41849" type="spur" key="ro_rescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrescit</orth>, a false read. for rarescit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 246</bibl>; v. Bach ad h. l.</entryFree>
roridus: <entryFree id="n41850" type="main" key="ro_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros</etym>, <sense id="n41850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bedewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dewy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet with dew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga jugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:4:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rorifer: <entryFree id="n41851" type="main" key="ro_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros-fero</etym>, <sense id="n41851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dewbringing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 864</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 338</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rorifluus: <entryFree id="n41852" type="hapax" key="ro_ri^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n41852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dripping with dew</hi>, Poët. ap. Catalect. 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
roriger: <entryFree id="n41853" type="hapax" key="ro_ri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros-gero</etym>, <sense id="n41853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dew-bringing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
roro: <entryFree id="n41854" type="main" key="ro_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [ros], <hi rend="ital">to let fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">distil dew</hi> (syn. stillo). </sense><sense id="n41854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41854.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: (Aurora) toto rorat in <pb n="1600" /> <cb n="ROSA" /> orbe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 622</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rorare Tithonia conjux Coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:403" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rorate, caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 45, 8</bibl></cit>. — More usually <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dew falls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it drizzles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it sprinkles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante rorat quam pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:76" default="NO">76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41854.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus rorata mane pruinā,</quote> <trans><tr>moistened</tr>, <tr>besprinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:357" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 357</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41854.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41854.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis spargunt rorantibus ora genasque,</quote> <trans><tr>with trickling</tr>, <tr>flowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 977</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, b.): rorant pennaeque sinusque, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shed moisture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:488" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora dei madidā barbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:683" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 683</bibl>; 177; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 786: sanguine vepres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 645</bibl></cit>;
