<bibl default="NO">11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte capellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostili cruore arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41854.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bedew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstant, lacrimis rorantes ora genasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:263" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 263</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">And with the liquid as an object: quam caelum intrare parantem Roratis lustravit aquis Iris,</quote> <trans><tr>with sprinkled waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:728" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 728</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si roraverit quantulum cumque imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 74</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: pocula rorantia, <hi rend="ital">which yielded the wine drop by drop</hi> (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)piyeka/zein</foreign>), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl>: rorans juvenis, <hi rend="ital">the youth pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the young cup-bearer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ganymedes</hi>, as a constellation (Aquarius), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 482</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41854.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si minutis illis suis et rorantibus responsionibus satisfaciet consulenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rorulentus: <entryFree id="n41855" type="main" key="ro_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros</etym>, <sense id="n41855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of dew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dewy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedewed</hi> (cf. roscidus): <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 4</bibl></cit>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 170 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:6" default="NO">12, 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ros: <entryFree id="n41856" type="main" key="ro_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōs</orth>, <itype>rōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>n.</gen>, ros nocturnum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>; cf. infra, II. B.) [perh. kindr. with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/rsh,</foreign> dew; Sanscr. varshas, rain]. <sense id="n41856.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae gemmantes rore recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 319</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 461</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros si non cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnum excipere rorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rore mero jejunia pavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecori gratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 326</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:312" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidos rores, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14: cadunt rores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:225" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inter aquam et rorem interest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41856.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41856.2" n="A" level="2"> Of any liquid falling in drops, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">infuso lympharum rore superne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 496</bibl></cit>, cf. liquoris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 777</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 438</bibl></cit>; and simply ros, of <hi rend="ital">water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:21:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 635</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 57 al.</bibl> —In <number>plur.</number>: pluvii, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rain clouds</hi>, Hor C. 3, 3, 56.—Of tears: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 708</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 360</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 430</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 36</bibl>.—Of breastmilk: natos vitali rore rigabat, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20.— Of blood; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:673" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 673</bibl></cit>.—Of perfumes: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41856.3" n="B" level="2"> Ros marinus, marinus ros, or in one word, rosmarinus, and in a <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form, rosmarinum (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">rosemary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosmarinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinus ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rorismarini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 36</bibl></cit> (twice): <cit><quote lang="la">marino rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 16</bibl></cit>: rosmarinum, <case>nom.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 59, § 99</bibl>; <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Ovid also: ros maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 410</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 690</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in Vergil simply ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 213</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 60, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosa: <entryFree id="n41857" type="main" key="ro^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">r(o/don</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n41857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rose.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41857.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr R. R. 1, 35, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paestanae rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:42:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 42, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape rosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:59:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sacred to Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 76</bibl> and 92; <cit><quote lang="la">blooms latest of the spring flowers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, sera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero's reproach: cum rosam viderat, tum incipere ver arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>.—Used on festive and solemn occasions for wreaths, for strewing in the way or upon graves, at feasts, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 627</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 22</bibl>; 29, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO">3, 5</bibl> (4, 4), 22; 4 (5), 8, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 769" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 769</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl> et saep.; cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 32 (2d edit.): plena rosarum Atria. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 113</bibl>.— Prov.: inter<cb n="ROSC" />  vepres rosae nascuntur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n41857.2" n="B" level="2"> Collect., for <hi rend="ital">roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreaths of roses</hi> (only so in class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sertis redimiri jubebis et rosā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu me in violā putabas aut in rosā dicere?</quote> <trans><tr>on</tr>, <tr>among roses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rosā potare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:77:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 77, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multā in rosā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinus perlucidus rosā fartus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41857.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41857.4" n="A" level="2"> As a word of endearment, in Plautus: <cit><quote lang="la">mea rosa,</quote> <trans><tr>my rose</tr>, <tr>my rosebud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 50</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or simply rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi rosa es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41857.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Oil of roses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n41857.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The season</hi> or <hi rend="ital">month of roses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 753, 4</bibl>; cf. rosales.—</sense><sense id="n41857.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The rose-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rose-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium breves Flores amoenae ferre jube rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix silvestris rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 41, 63, § 152</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores rosarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 627</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram ad rosarum et vineae satum vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rosaceus: <entryFree id="n41858" type="main" key="ro^sa_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rosa</etym>, <sense id="n41858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rose-</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 6, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsācĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">oil of roses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:68" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 23, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosales: <entryFree id="n41859" type="gloss" key="ro^sa_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsāles escae</orth> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an annual feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the tombs were adorned with garlands of roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the feast of roses;</hi> cf. our Decoration day, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4419</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ROSAE ET ESCAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4418</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">The ceremony of hanging up the garlands</hi> was called <itype>ROSALIA, ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 146, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosans: <entryFree id="n41860" type="hapax" key="ro^sans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obsol. roso], <sense id="n41860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rosecolored</hi>, Poët. ap. Catalect. 2, 28.</sense></entryFree>
rosarius: <entryFree id="n41861" type="main" key="ro^sa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rosa</etym>, <sense id="n41861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rose-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41861.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: absorptio, <hi rend="ital">a drink flavored with roses</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">something similar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <trans><tr>expected from drinking it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 141, 1</bibl></cit>: venenum, <hi rend="ital">of the laurel rose</hi>, supposed to be poisonous, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>, p. 143, 20.—</sense><sense id="n41861.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n41861.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place planted with roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rose-garden; sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 29</bibl>. — More freq. <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5:59" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5, 59</bibl> (5, 5, 61); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 23</bibl>; Col. praef. § 27 al.— </sense><sense id="n41861.4" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">r(odopw/lhs,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
rosatus: <entryFree id="n41862" type="main" key="ro^sa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared from roses</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 34, 637</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rose wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 32</bibl>, id. Mai, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 11</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also,</quote> <trans><tr>conserve of roses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
roscianus: <entryFree id="n41863" type="main" key="Rosci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Roscĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Roscius, III. B.</entryFree>
roscidus: <entryFree id="n41864" type="main" key="rosci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">roscĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ros</etym>, <sense id="n41864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of dew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet with dew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dewy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41864.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 37</bibl></cit>. umor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <trans><tr>dropping like dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Aurora</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 314</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 62, 62, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:260" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 67, § 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 700</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">roscida caespitum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dewy meadows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 102, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41864.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">moistened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rivis Hernica saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
roscius: <entryFree id="n41865" type="main" key="Rosci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Roscĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n41865.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Roscius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman ambassador</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain in a revolt at Fidenæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41865.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Roscius Otho, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when tribune of the people</hi>, A. U.C. 686, <hi rend="ital">carried through a law that fourteen rows of seats in the theatre next to those of the senators should be appropriated to the knights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 99</bibl>; Ascon. ap. Cornel. p. 784; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:324" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 324</bibl>. The law just referred to was called Lex Roscia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 32</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41865.3" n="III" level="1"> Q. Roscius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">a freedman from Lanuvium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very celebrated actor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the intimate friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who defended him in an oration still extant.</hi> His excellence soon became proverbial: <cit><quote lang="la">videtisne, quam nihil ab eo (sc. Roscio) nisi perfecte, nihil nisi cum summā venustate flat, etc.... Itaque hoc jam diu est consecutus, ut in quo quisque artificio excelleret, is in suo genere Roscius diceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">59, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 82</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n41865.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Roscĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Roscian</hi>: imitatio senis, <cb n="ROST" /> <hi rend="ital">Roscius</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41865.5" n="IV" level="1"> Sex. Roscius, <hi rend="ital">of Ameria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defended by Cicero</hi>, A. U. C. 674, <hi rend="ital">in an oration still extant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 312</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41865.6" n="V" level="1"> Lucius Roscius, <hi rend="ital">who commanded a legion under Cæsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosea: <entryFree id="n41866" type="main" key="Ro_se^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very fertile district near Reate</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Le Roscie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:16" default="NO">2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:2:9" default="NO">3, 2, 9</bibl> and 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41866.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rosea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rosean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cannabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 174</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41866.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĕānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rosean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rosetum: <entryFree id="n41867" type="main" key="ro^se_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rosa</etym>, <sense id="n41867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bed of roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rosary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
roseus: <entryFree id="n41868" type="main" key="ro^se^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41868.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rose-</hi> (rare, for rosaceus): <cit><quote lang="la">strophium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 70</bibl></cit>: flores, i. e. <hi rend="ital">roses</hi>, Claud. de Magnete, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">convalles,</quote> <trans><tr>filled with roses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Rapt. Pros. 3:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 85</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41868.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rose-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rosy</hi> (freq., esp. in the Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 166</bibl></cit> (Jahn, russeus); 29, 4, 17, § 64 (Jahn, russeus); <cit><quote lang="la">30, 11, 30, § 99 (Jahn, russeus): nitor quidam in purpurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">color (with purpureus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6, 26, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseā sol alte lampade lucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 610</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 976</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 913</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 656</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same, os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:94" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:714" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 714</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eous,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 24, 7; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alae (Luciferi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:527" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (Iridis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 77</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a poetical epithet of any thing blooming with youth, esp. parts of the body, <hi rend="ital">rosy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os (Veneris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 402</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:257" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41869" type="main" key="Ro_se^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rosea, A.</entryFree>
rosidus: <entryFree id="n41870" type="spur" key="ro_si^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōsĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false writing for roscidus.</entryFree>
rosina: <entryFree id="n41871" type="main" key="rosina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rosina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <sense id="n41871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosio: <entryFree id="n41872" type="main" key="ro_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rodo</etym>; <sense id="n41872.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in medic. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>a gnawing</tr>, <tr>corrosion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 17</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:128" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 33, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rosmarinum: <entryFree id="n41873" type="main" key="rosma^ri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rosmărīnum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rosmărīnus</orth>, v. ros, II. B.</entryFree>
rostellum: <entryFree id="n41874" type="main" key="rostellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rostellum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">i</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rostrum</etym>, <sense id="n41874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little beak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snout</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullorum (avium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rostra: <entryFree id="n41875" type="main" key="rostra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rostra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. rostrum, II. C.</entryFree>
rostralis: <entryFree id="n41876" type="hapax" key="rostra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rostrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rostrum, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n41876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> rostra: tabula (with Capitolina), i. e. <hi rend="ital">a tablet on the</hi> rostra, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rostrans: <entryFree id="n41877" type="main" key="rostrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rostrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rostrum</etym>, <sense id="n41877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">driving in its point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 178</bibl></cit> dub. (perh. rostrato, v. rostratus).</sense></entryFree>
rostratus: <entryFree id="n41878" type="main" key="rostra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rostrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a beak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hook</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crooked point; beaked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved at the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rostrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 63</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 23; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus liburnicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>: rostrata corona = navalis corona, <hi rend="ital">a crown ornamented with small figures of beaks of ships</hi>, <hi rend="ital">given to him who first boarded the enemy</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 3, 4, § 6</bibl>.— Hence, in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Agrippae) Tempora navali fulgent rostrata coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 684</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, Columna rostrata,</quote> <trans><tr>a column erected in the Forum</tr>, <tr>to commemorate the naval victory of Duilius in the first Punic war</tr>, <tr>which was adorned with the beaks of the conquered vessels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:663" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 663</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">also in the order rostrata columna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the parts of the inscription on this column still extant (one of the oldest monuments of Latin literature), with modern restorations,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 549</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rostrum: <entryFree id="n41879" type="main" key="ro_strum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōstrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rodo</etym>, <sense id="n41879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beak of a bird; the snout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouth</hi> of animals (cf. proboscis). </sense><sense id="n41879.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum arripere aduncitate rostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves corneo proceroque rostro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 376</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 545</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 673</bibl> et saep. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes tortis cornibus pronis ad rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of goats,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of swine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1601" /> <cb n="ROTA" /> 13, 23; 2, 21, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 371</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 713</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 282</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of dogs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:536" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 536</bibl></cit>; 3, 249; <cit><quote lang="la">of wolves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 44, § 157</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of stags,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a dolphin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of tortoises,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of bees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 21</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41879.2" n="B" level="2"> In familiar or contemptuous lang., like our <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snout</hi>, of persons, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. squarrosi, p. 329 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; Lucil., Nov., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, of human statues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41879.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41879.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of objects having a similar shape, <hi rend="ital">the curved point</hi> of a vine-dresser's billhook, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a plough,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of hammers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 144</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of lamps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an island,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41879.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq., <hi rend="ital">the curved end of a ship</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s prow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s beak; sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque his (navibus) nostrae rostro nocere poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis, cui argenteum aut aureum rostrum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:705 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 705 al.</bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 44, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">46, 2.—Sometimes of a triple form: convolsum remis rostrisque tridentibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:688" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 688</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum trifidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 358</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41879.6" n="C" level="2"> Rostra, <hi rend="ital">the Rostra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">platform for speakers in the Forum</hi>, so called from being adorned with the beaks of ships taken from the Antians A.U.C. 416, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Mil. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Mil. p. 43</bibl> Orell.; cf. Becker, Antiq. I. p. 279 sq. and p. 290; and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the place from which the assembled people were addressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the orator</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pulpit</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">platform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semper in rostris curiam, in senatu populum defenderim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in rostris prius quam in senatu litterae recitarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rostra escendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere ad rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere in rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:65:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Vettius descendisset de rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de rostris deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem a subselliis ad rostra detulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Sulpicii erectum et ostentatum pro rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem defunctum laudare e more pro rostris (v. pro, II. 2.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro rostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>; 20; 79; 84; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>; 5, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: laudavit ipse apud rostra formam ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus a rostris manat per compita rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum forumque optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 65</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">campumque et rostra movebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the assembled people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 685</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rosula: <entryFree id="n41880" type="main" key="ro^su^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rosa</etym>, <sense id="n41880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little rose</hi> (late Lat.), Dracont. Hexaëm. 597.</sense></entryFree>
rosulentus: <entryFree id="n41881" type="main" key="ro^su^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏsŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n41881.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Abounding in roses</hi>: prata, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 3, 199.—* </sense><sense id="n41881.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rose-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rosy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rosus: <entryFree id="n41882" type="main" key="ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of rodo.</entryFree>
rota: <entryFree id="n41883" type="main" key="ro^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. ratha, chariot, and Germ. Rad (cf.rotundus), wheel</etym>, <sense id="n41883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wheel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro rotā me uti licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vorsutior es quam rota figularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 551</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">axes rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea curvatura summae rotae, Ov M. 2, 108: aquaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: ne currente rotā funis eat retro, <hi rend="ital">while the wheel</hi> (in a hoisting machine) <hi rend="ital">hurries forward</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 10</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41883.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41883.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A potter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wheel</hi> (cf. supra, figularis): <cit><quote lang="la">amphora coepit Institui: currente rotā cur urceus exit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cumana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristarchus invenit rotam figuli, cujus circuitu vasa formantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41883.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A wheel for torture</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">troxo/s,</foreign> among the Greeks): <cit><quote lang="la">in rotam beatam vitam non escendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem circumactu rotae frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 243; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1011" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1011</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Ixion</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:74" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 616</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 750" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 750</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41883.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A roller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid subjectis rotis traicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41883.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n41883.7" n="1" level="3"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">A car</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chariot</hi>: si rota defuerit, tu pede carpe viam, Ov.A. A. 2,230; cf. (opp. <cb n="ROTU" /> pedibus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:M. 1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 448</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO">2, 25</bibl> (3, 20), 26; <cit><quote lang="la">4 (5), 10, 42: subdiderat rotas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 675</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">312</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 150</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">the span of horses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia fraternis afflata rotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:483" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41883.8" n="2" level="3"> Of things in the shape of a wheel or disk. </sense><sense id="n41883.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The disk</hi> of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">solis rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:564" default="NO" valid="yes">564</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammea Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1022" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1022</bibl></cit>; and simply rota, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:559" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 559</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41883.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41883.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wheel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae rotam pertimescere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fickleness</tr>, <tr>inconstancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">versatur celeri Fors levis orbe rotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl> (10); <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 8, 13</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imparibus vecta Thalia rotis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in elegiac metre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 264</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">disparibus (elegorum) rotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: jactor, crucior, agitor, stimulor, vorsor in amoris rotā miser, <hi rend="ital">on the rack of love</hi> (cf. I. A. 2. b. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotabilis: <entryFree id="n41884" type="main" key="ro^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rota</etym>. <sense id="n41884.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Whirling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotary</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">flexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41884.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a road, <hi rend="ital">practicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIAM INVIAM ROTAB. REDD.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 149, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotalis: <entryFree id="n41885" type="main" key="ro^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having wheels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheeled</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">carpentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotatilis: <entryFree id="n41886" type="main" key="ro^ta_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>roto</etym>, <sense id="n41886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheel-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gyri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: trochaei, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> praef. 8.</sense></entryFree>
rotatim: <entryFree id="n41887" type="main" key="ro^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a wheel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in orbem saltantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 19</bibl></cit> (al. rotarum).</sense></entryFree>
rotatio: <entryFree id="n41888" type="main" key="ro^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wheeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning about in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init. et fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rotator: <entryFree id="n41889" type="main" key="ro^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who turns</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">round in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whirler round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassaridum (Evan),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotatus: <entryFree id="n41890" type="main" key="ro^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whirling round</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 417</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 362</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
roto: <entryFree id="n41891" type="main" key="ro^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rota</etym>. <sense id="n41891.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">round like a wheel; to swing round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirl about</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. torqueo). </sense><sense id="n41891.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Learchum bis terque per auras More rotat fundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 374</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare caput et comas excutientem rotare, fanaticum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineos orbes (i. e. oculos),</quote> <trans><tr>to roll about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 235</bibl></cit>: ensem fulmineum, <hi rend="ital">to brandish</hi> (in order to add force to the blow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 441</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum in ora loquentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:802" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum, Val Fl. 6, 551: saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam (venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti) trudunt res ante rapidique rotanti turbine portant,</quote> <trans><tr>in a whirling tornado</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in vulnus (ursa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conreptum rotatumque sternit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 51</bibl></cit>.— Mid., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go round in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roll round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrheni greges circumque infraque rotantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum caput igne rotato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poterisne rotatis Obvius ire polis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nivibus rotatis (with glomerari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 221</bibl></cit>: sphaerico motu in orbem rotari, Macr Somn. Scip. 2, 14, 31.— * </sense><sense id="n41891.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut curtum sermone rotato Torqueat enthymema,</quote> <trans><tr>round</tr>, <tr>compact</tr>, <tr>concise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:449" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ordinem fati rerum aeterna series rotat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:35:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41891.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, = rotari, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revolve</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">parte ex aliā, quā saxa rotantia late Impulerat torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 362</bibl></cit> Serv. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volventia plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 163</bibl></cit>); <cit><quote lang="la">so of a peacock spreading its tail out like a wheel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotomagi: <entryFree id="n41892" type="main" key="Rotoma^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rotomăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Gallia Lugdunensis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rouen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotula: <entryFree id="n41893" type="main" key="ro^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:50" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 50</bibl>), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rota</etym>, <sense id="n41893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotundatio: <entryFree id="n41894" type="main" key="ro^tunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rotundo</etym>, <sense id="n41894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea rotundationis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the circumference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotunde: <entryFree id="n41895" type="main" key="ro^tunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rotundus <sense id="n41895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rotundifolius: <entryFree id="n41896" type="main" key="ro^tundi^fo^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundĭfŏlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rotundusfolium</etym>, <sense id="n41896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round-leaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotundifolious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotunditas: <entryFree id="n41897" type="main" key="ro^tundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rotundus</etym>, <sense id="n41897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round</hi> <cb n="RUBE" /> <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotundity</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n41897.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma rotunditatis absolutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:86" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 23, 35, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:76 al" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 25, § 76 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41897.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>a roundness</tr>, <tr>smoothness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Symmachi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">a circular space</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunditas dimidii cubiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotundo: <entryFree id="n41898" type="main" key="ro^tundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rotundus</etym>, <sense id="n41898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to round off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi> (syn. torno). </sense><sense id="n41898.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum similem universitatis naturae efficere vellet, ad volubilitatem rotundavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignum ad circinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum in modum papillae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem solis (with curvare aequaliter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (flamma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae in caulem rotundantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 66, § 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41898.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">to round off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate</hi>, (very rare): elegos acutos ac rotundatos hendecasyllabos elucubrare, <hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl>. —Of a sum of money, <hi rend="ital">to make up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi> (cf. corrotundo): <cit><quote lang="la">mille talenta rotundentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rotundula: <entryFree id="n41899" type="hapax" key="ro^tundu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little round mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pellet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rotundus: <entryFree id="n41900" type="main" key="ro^tundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rŭt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rota</etym>, <sense id="n41900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheel-shaped</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotund</hi> (very freq. and class.; cf. teres). </sense><sense id="n41900.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ea, quae fuerint juxtim quadrata, procul sint Visa rotunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 502</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae globosae et rotundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum rotundum esse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum ita tornavit, ut nihil effici possit rotundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capita rotundiora ... rotundissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus infimus in rotundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging evenly all round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: diruit, aedificat, mutat quadrata rotundis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turns every thing upside down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41900.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41900.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens Fortis et in se ipse totus, teres atque rotundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa rotunda et undique circumcisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41900.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech (opp. rough, unpolished), <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well turned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi> (in Cic. with quasi or ut ita dicam added;
