but <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <pos>adv.</pos> b.): <cit><quote lang="la">erat verborum et delectus elegans et apta et quasi rotunda constructio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides praefractior nec satis, ut ita dicam, rotundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiis dedit ore rotundo Musa loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 323</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">celeris ac rotunda distributio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunda volubilisque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotundi numeri (with brevis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏtun-dē</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n41900.5" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Roundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in orbem quam rotundissime formetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n41900.6" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Roundly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoothly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te quidem apte ac rotunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
roxane: <entryFree id="n41901" type="main" key="Ro_xa_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rōxānē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(Rwca/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n41901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of the Persian Oxyartes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:9" default="NO">10, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:13" default="NO">10, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2:4 al" default="NO">15, 2, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
roxolani: <entryFree id="n41902" type="main" key="Roxola_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Roxolāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhox-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people upon the rivers Don and Dnieper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 2099, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 453</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubedo: <entryFree id="n41903" type="hapax" key="ru^be_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rubeo</etym>, <sense id="n41903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">redness</hi>, Firm. Math. 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
rubefacio: <entryFree id="n41904" type="main" key="ru^be^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine setas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubefactaque sanguine tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:394" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua multo cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:382" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora sororum (Aurora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:137" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubellianus: <entryFree id="n41905" type="hapax" key="ru^belli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rubellus</etym>, <sense id="n41905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubellio: <entryFree id="n41906" type="main" key="ru^belli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish of a reddish color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 49, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubellulus: <entryFree id="n41907" type="main" key="ru^bellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbellŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n41907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a little reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbilicus (voluminis), Mart. Cap. poët. 5, § 566: rhamnos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubellus: <entryFree id="n41908" type="main" key="ru^bellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n41908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [ruber], <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientanum (vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:104:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 104, 9</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:147" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 147</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubens: <entryFree id="n41909" type="main" key="ru^bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of rubeo.</entryFree>
rubeo: <entryFree id="n41910" type="main" key="ru^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>v. ruber</etym>, <sense id="n41910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41910.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ulceribus quasi inustis omne rubere Corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1602" /> <cb n="RUBI" /> 1166: <cit><quote lang="la">per herbas Matutina rubent radiati lumina solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 462</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli flendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio murice lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine litus Undaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 375</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineis aviaria baccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 430</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41910.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41910.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be reddened by blood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigea rubebant Litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 71</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, with sanguine and cruore).—</sense><sense id="n41910.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubeo, mihi crede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2</bibl>. 1, 267; 2, 2, 156; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 166</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">being red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41910.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in picturis ostroque rubenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubenti minio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere rubenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubente dextera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rubente folio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 10, § 29</bibl></cit> (Jahn, in foliorum venis): <cit><quote lang="la">rubentibus auriculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur iracundissime sint flavi rubentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:19:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superficies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 89</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41910.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">red with shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blushing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Inficitur teneras ore rubente genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore rubenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 327</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruber: <entryFree id="n41911" type="main" key="ru^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype> (collat. form, <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbrus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 23</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. rudhira, blood; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/s,</foreign> red; ef. rufus</etym>. <sense id="n41911.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rufus, russus): umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1051" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1051</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruore pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 404</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapus,</quote> <trans><tr>painted red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1,400</bibl></cit> (cf. rubicundus): <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) cum Praecipitem oceani rubro lavit aequore currum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reddened by the setting sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3,359</bibl></cit>; cf.: juvenum recens Examen Eois timendum Partibus Oceanoque rubro, <hi rend="ital">the Eastern</hi> (i. e. Indian) <hi rend="ital">Ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 32</bibl> (cf. infra, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">rubriore pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitri quam ruberrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 31</bibl></cit> et saep. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges majorum (because their titles were written in red letters),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41911.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41911.2" n="A" level="2"> Rubrum Mare, <hi rend="ital">the Red Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Arabian and Persian Gulfs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:8" default="NO">3, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:1" default="NO">3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 28, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO">3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:231" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52, 12</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubra aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 29</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41911.3" n="B" level="2"> Saxa Rubra, <hi rend="ital">a place between Rome and Veii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the river Cremera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with stone-quarries</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grotta rossa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called breves Rubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubesco: <entryFree id="n41912" type="main" key="ru^besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [rubeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 521</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 600</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare radiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae mundusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa sanguine vatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva novā Neptunia caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <trans><tr>blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius numquam non coram pluribus rubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl></cit> (Jahn, rufescentia): <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 63, § 167</bibl></cit> (Jahn, rufescunt).</sense></entryFree>
rubeta: <entryFree id="n41913" type="main" key="ru^be_ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rubus</etym>, <sense id="n41913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of venomous toad living among bramble-bushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:659" default="NO">6, 659</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 31, 48, § 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:48" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl> (4, 5), 27.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41914" type="main" key="ru^be_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbēta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bramblethickets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:509" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 509</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubeus: <entryFree id="n41915" type="main" key="ru^be^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏbeus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŏbus</orth>; cf. Fest. s. v. robum, p. 264 Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rubeo</etym>, <sense id="n41915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO">8, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41916" type="hapax" key="ru^be^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rubus</etym>, <sense id="n41916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the bramble-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <trans><tr>a bramble-twig</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubi: <entryFree id="n41917" type="main" key="Ru^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭbi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ruvo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 94</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭbustī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Rubi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 127" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 127</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
rubia: <entryFree id="n41918" type="main" key="ru^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. rubeus</etym>, <sense id="n41918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 17, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam aliqui ereuthodanum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 56, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 26, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubico: <entryFree id="n41919" type="main" key="Ru^bi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭbĭco</orth> (<case>nom.</case> Rubicon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 214</bibl> Cort. <sense id="n41919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a small river on the east coast of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which formed the boundary between Italy and Cisalpine Gaul; celebrated for having been crossed by Cœsar at</hi> <cb n="RUBR" /> <hi rend="ital">the breaking out of the civil war;</hi> prob. the modern <hi rend="ital">Pisatello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubicundulus: <entryFree id="n41920" type="hapax" key="ru^bi^cundu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĭcundŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n41920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rubicundus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat ruddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:424" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 424</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubicundus: <entryFree id="n41921" type="main" key="ru^bi^cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĭcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rubeo</etym>, <sense id="n41921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rufus quidam, ore rubicundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapus,</quote> <trans><tr>painted red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:319" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 319</bibl></cit> (cf. ruber): Ceres, <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, for flava, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus cometae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubidus: <entryFree id="n41922" type="main" key="ru^bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark-red</hi> (rare), cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cas 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. pp. 262 and 263 Müll.: facies ex vinolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubigo: <entryFree id="n41923" type="main" key="ru_bi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūbīgo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rūbīgālis</orth>, etc., v. robig-.</entryFree>
rubor: <entryFree id="n41924" type="main" key="ru^bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rubeo</etym>, <sense id="n41924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">redness</hi> of all shades, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 5</bibl> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41924.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">candore mixtus rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta ruboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 5 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui plurimus ignem Subjecit rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:66 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 66 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam ruboris acerrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 38, 91, § 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore impudentia multo rubore effusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrios incocta rubores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles rubores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 664" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41924.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a blush.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41924.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem rubor consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masinissae haec audienti non rubor solum suffusus, sed lacrimae etiam obortae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 484</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 450</bibl>; 4, 329; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 47.—In a comic equivoque: in ruborem te totum dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will make you red all over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 37 sq.</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n41924.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">shamefacedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modesty</hi> (syn. pudor; <cit><quote lang="la">not freq. till after the Aug. per.): (orator) praestet ingenuitatem et ruborem suum verborum turpitudine et rerum obscenitate vitandā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ruborem incutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruborem afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox, quae vel rabulae cuivis ruborem inicere potest,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to the blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu modesto ruborisque pleno (shortly after: verecundia oris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41924.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., after the Aug. per., by a further meton. (like pudor), <hi rend="ital">the cause of shame; shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoris judicium nihil fere damnato nisi ruborem affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tunicam tibi sit posuisse, rubori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duas res ei rubori fuisse, unam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 35, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rubori est (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: nec rubor est emisse palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem quippe ruborem fore in juris iniquitate, quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil tua facta ruboris habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor ac dedecus penes omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe minus est constantiae in rubore quam in culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubrensis: <entryFree id="n41925" type="main" key="Ru^brensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭbrensis</orth> <itype>lacus</itype>, <sense id="n41925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake of Gallia Narbonensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Narbonne</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">L</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Etang de Sigoan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ-brēsus</orth> <itype>lacus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubrianus: <entryFree id="n41926" type="main" key="Rubri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rubrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rubrius, II.</entryFree>
rubrica: <entryFree id="n41927" type="main" key="ru^_bri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭ_brīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from ruberica, from ruber</etym> (sc. terra), <sense id="n41927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red earth</hi> of any kind. </sense><sense id="n41927.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41927.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">red earth for coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red-ochre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red-chalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccas rubrica, cera omne corpus intinxit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubricā delibatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 22, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia rubricā picta aut carbone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 14, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 30, 35, § 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si oculo rubricam dirigat uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n41927.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n41927.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rubric</hi> (because written in red): interdicta proponuntur sub rubricā Unde vi (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. 8, 4) aliqua enim sub hoc titulo interdicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n41927.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad album ac rubricas transtulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masuri rubrica vetavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rubricatus: <entryFree id="n41928" type="main" key="ru^_bri^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭ_brĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of rubrico. <cb n="RUDE" /></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41929" type="main" key="Ru^_bri^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ_brĭcātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ_brĭ-cātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n41929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which falls into the Mediterranean Sea.</hi>—Form Rubricatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—Form Rubricatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubrico: <entryFree id="n41930" type="main" key="ru^bri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbrīco</orth>, no <sense id="n41930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rubrica</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to color red</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">furi rubricato minare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 73, 2</bibl></cit>; Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubricosus: <entryFree id="n41931" type="main" key="ru^bri_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbrīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of ruddle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">red-ochre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 46, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rubrius: <entryFree id="n41932" type="main" key="Ru^_bri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ_brĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ_brĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> Rubrius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Rubria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: Lex Rubria (or lex Galliae Cisalpinae), of the year B. C. 43; v. Becker, Antiq. 3, 1, p. 51, and the authors there cited.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41932.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ_brĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Rubrius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rubrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:26:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 26, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:28" default="NO">40, 5, 28</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
rubrus: <entryFree id="n41933" type="main" key="rubrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rubrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ruber <sense id="n41933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rubus: <entryFree id="n41934" type="main" key="ru^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n41934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoth. 123</bibl>) [kindr. with ruber]. </sense><sense id="n41934.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bramble-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackberry-bush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 71, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:96" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 13, 21, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:117 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 13, 73, § 117 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41934.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blackberry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 28: <cit><quote lang="la">fraga rubosque colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ructabundus: <entryFree id="n41935" type="main" key="ructa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ructo</etym>, <sense id="n41935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belching again and again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ructamen: <entryFree id="n41936" type="hapax" key="ructa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a belching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eructation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 467</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ructatio: <entryFree id="n41937" type="main" key="ructa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a belching</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:56" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ructatrix: <entryFree id="n41938" type="main" key="ructa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ructator</etym>, <sense id="n41938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that belches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentha,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that produces belching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ructatus: <entryFree id="n41939" type="main" key="ructa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ructo</etym>, = ructatio, Aug. c. Faust. 5, 10.</entryFree>
ructo: <entryFree id="n41940" type="main" key="ructo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ructor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ructatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 457</bibl></cit>: ructaretur, Cic. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=263" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 263</bibl> Müll.) [rugo, whence ructus, erugo, eructo], <hi rend="ital">to belch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eructate</hi> (class). </sense><sense id="n41940.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41940.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ructare alicui in os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ructare turpe est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam exspuisse, numquam ructasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 19, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene ructavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41940.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to belch up</hi> a thing: aves hospitales, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have the taste of them in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mouth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 68, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem exiguam cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:49:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:685" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 685</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:435" default="NO">15, 435</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41940.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum (terra),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to send forth</tr>, <tr>emit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41940.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in a contemptuous sense, <hi rend="ital">to belch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi> (cf. evomo): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 457</bibl></cit>: propinquitates semideum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be always talking about them</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potor Mosellae Tiberim ructas,</quote> <trans><tr>though a Gaul</tr>, <tr>you speak like a Roman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ructor: <entryFree id="n41941" type="main" key="ructor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. ructo <sense id="n41941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ructuo: <entryFree id="n41942" type="main" key="ructu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ructus</etym>, <sense id="n41942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to belch forth</hi> (late Lat. for the usual ructare); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Temp. 135" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Temp. 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ructuosus: <entryFree id="n41943" type="hapax" key="ructu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of belches</hi>: spiritus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ructus: <entryFree id="n41944" type="main" key="ructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ructus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rugo, whence also ructo and erugo</etym>, <sense id="n41944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a belching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eructation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising of the stomach</hi> (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): exhalas acidos ex pectore ructus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis ructus mihist,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedi pestilentesque ructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:174" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 17, 66, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:4 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rudectus: <entryFree id="n41945" type="main" key="ru_dectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rudus</etym>, <sense id="n41945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rubbish</hi>, i. e. (of soil) <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rudens: <entryFree id="n41946" type="main" key="ru^dens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<sense id="n41946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> rudentium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>; Prud. adv. Symm. praef. 2; <case>abl.</case> rudenti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 1</bibl>) [etym. unknown; acc. to the <pb n="1603" /> <cb n="RUDI" /> ancients from rudo, on account of the rattling; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 51</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, c<hi rend="ital">ord</hi> (very freq. and class.; syn.: restis, funis). </sense><sense id="n41946.1" n="I" level="1"> Usu., <hi rend="ital">a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, belonging to the standing or running rigging of a ship; <hi rend="ital">a stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halyard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheet</hi>, etc.; <number>plur.</number> collect., <hi rend="ital">the rigging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cordage</hi>: clamor tonitruum et rudentum sibilus, Pac. ap. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 7</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 87</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 100 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Vergil: clamorque virum stridorque rudentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 616</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 474</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">495</bibl> et saep.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n41946.2" n="B" level="2"> Rudens, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy by Plautus.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n41946.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentem explicavit immensum,</quote> <trans><tr>spun a long yarn</tr>, <tr>unfolded a prodigious series of facts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 6</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentibus apta fortuna,</quote> <trans><tr>a very uncertain fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41946.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The rope of an engine of war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41947" type="main" key="ru^dens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of rudo.</entryFree>
ruderarius: <entryFree id="n41948" type="hapax" key="ru_de^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rudus</etym>, <sense id="n41948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rubbish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 212, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruderatio: <entryFree id="n41949" type="main" key="ru_de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rudero</etym>, <sense id="n41949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paving with rubbish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruderation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41949.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mass of broken stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudero: <entryFree id="n41950" type="main" key="ru_de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rudus</etym>, <sense id="n41950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pave with broken stone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rubbish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudiae: <entryFree id="n41951" type="main" key="Ru^di^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭdĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Ennius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:397" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 397</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ-dīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Rudiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Rudian</hi>, an appellation of Ennius, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl> (Ann. v. 440 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. 13, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudiarii: <entryFree id="n41952" type="gloss" key="ru^di^a_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdĭārĭi</orth> <itype>ab eodem</itype> (sc. Cincio) dicuntur, qui saga nova poliunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl> Müll. [1. rudis].</entryFree>
rudiarius: <entryFree id="n41953" type="hapax" key="ru^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. rudis</etym>, <sense id="n41953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gladiator who is presented with a</hi> rudis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who receives his discharge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudicula: <entryFree id="n41954" type="main" key="ru^di^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden spoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spatula</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 95, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudiculā ligneā peragitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 54, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudimentum: <entryFree id="n41955" type="main" key="ru^di_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. rudis</etym>, <sense id="n41955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a first attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trial</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">essay; a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi> in any thing (not ante-Aug.; cf. tirocinium). </sense><sense id="n41955.1" n="I" level="1"> Most usual as milit. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudimentis militiae imbutus,</quote> <trans><tr>the elements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 157</bibl></cit>: rudimenta adulescentiae ponere, <hi rend="ital">to lay down the rudiments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete the first beginnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s novitiate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub militiā patris tirocinii rudimenta deposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41955.2" n="II" level="1"> In other things: <cit><quote lang="la">rudimentum primum puerilis regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima rhetorices rudimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>the first principles</tr>, <tr>rudiments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi Protogenis rudimenta cum ipsius naturae veritate certantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilium officiorum rudimentis regem Archelaum defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima pueritiae rudimenta deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, I.).</sense></entryFree>
rudinus: <entryFree id="n41956" type="main" key="Ru^di_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭdīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rudiae.</entryFree>
rudis: <entryFree id="n41957" type="main" key="ru^dis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. crudus</etym>, <sense id="n41957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi> (cf. crudus): omnis fere materia non deformata, rudis appellatur, sicut vestimentum rude, non perpolitum: sic aes infectum rudusculum, Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl> Müll. (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n41957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra (opp. restibilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:27:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis atque infecta materies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis indigestaque moles (Chaos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa (de marmore coepto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes (opp. signatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>rudely finished</tr>, <tr>ill-made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 743</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novacula (with retusa),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumjectus parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit> (with informes tegulae): <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">textum,</quote> <trans><tr>rough</tr>, <tr>coarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 640</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:659" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90, 8</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <trans><tr>unripe</tr>, <tr>green</tr>, <tr>hard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 68</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: detrahit doctrina aliquid, ut lima <cb n="RUDI" /> rudibus et cotes hebetibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n41957.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi> (cf. integer): <cit><quote lang="la">illa (carina, sc. Argo) rudem cursu prima imbuit Amphitriten,</quote> <trans><tr>untried</tr>, <tr>not yet sailed on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also, Argo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:71:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 71, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 95, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram cruore regio imbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 217" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannas,</quote> <trans><tr>new</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41957.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clumsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant;</hi> hence (like ignarus), with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperienced in</hi>, etc. (cf. imperitus). </sense><sense id="n41957.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forma ingenii impolita et plane rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:294" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 85, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohata ac rudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae rudia atque imperfecta adhuc erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudia et incomposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox surda, rudis, immanis, dura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modus (tibicinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rude et Graecis intactum carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus (with confusus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:3" default="NO">12, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit> (with agrestes); <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1, 36: adhuc ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis fuit vita priscorum et sine litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:23" default="NO">12, 11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>young</tr>, <tr>early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudem me et integrum discipulum accipe et ea, quae requiro, doce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:83" default="NO">3, 6, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeschylus rudis in plerisque et incompositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam eram rudis? tam ignarus rerum? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>; so (with ignarus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis ac stultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rudes homines primique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:5" default="NO">10, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rudes ac bellicosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit equo rudis Haerere ingenuus puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41957.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum superiores alii fuissent in disputationibus perpoliti, alii in disserendo rudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratorem) nullā in re tironem ac rudem esse debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>; (with hebes) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 58, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis in re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in minoribus navigiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino in nostris poëtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo nullā in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>.—With simple <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius ingenio maximus, arte rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:424" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:437" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41957.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiti homines rerum omnium rudes ignarique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicat se non imperitum foederis, non rudem exemplorum, non ignarum belli fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecarum litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonarum artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum (elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum conjugiique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:336" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sleepless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41957.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rudem ad pedestria bella Numidarum gentem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 5</bibl></cit>:
