<cit><quote lang="la">ad quae (spectacula) rudes tum Romani erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 32, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudes adhuc ad resistendum populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis natio ad voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:21:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:24" default="NO">8, 8, 24</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fontes rudes puellis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>strange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ferre rudis medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:90" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martem rudis versare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 262</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41958" type="main" key="ru^dis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n41958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> rudi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Opil. Macr. 4, 5</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a slender stick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41958.1" n="I" level="1"> To stir with in cooking; <hi rend="ital">a stirring-stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spatula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versato crebro duabus rudibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ferreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>; cf. rudicula.—</sense><sense id="n41958.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A staff used by soldiers and gladiators in their exercises</hi> (perh. <hi rend="ital">a wooden sword</hi>), answering to <hi rend="ital">a quarter-staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foil</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(milites) rudibus inter se in modum justae pugnae concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 6</bibl> and 9 Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. sudibus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 515</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudibus batuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf.: PRIMA or SVMMA RVDIS (also in one word, SVMMARVDIS), <hi rend="ital">the first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">head fencer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fencing-master</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2575</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2584</bibl>: SECVNDA RVDIS, <hi rend="ital">the second fencer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fencing-master</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2573 sq.</bibl>—A gladiator received <cb n="RUGA" /> such a rudis when honorably discharged (whence he was called rudiarius): <cit><quote lang="la">tam bonus gladiator rudem tam cito accepisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptā rude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedario rudem indulgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.—And hence transf. to other persons who receive an honorable discharge: <cit><quote lang="la">tardā vires minuente senectā, Me quoque donari jam rude tempus erat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dismiss</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatum satis et donatum jam rude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit> (v. Orell. ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo sibi dabit ipse rudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:171" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:36:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 36, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
